Pictured here are members of the “Forward Ever” group from Waterloo, a small town near the capital city, Freetown. They are small businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their respective businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profits, and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Kumba. Kumba was born in the eastern city of Kono, 34 years ago. She is married, with 5 children. Two are in primary school and three in secondary school.  Kumba sells fish and has been running this business for 11 years. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy more fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to add to her business

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: El señor Alberto tiene 60 años de edad vive solo, tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya son mayores e independientes, alberto se dedica a manejar una moto taxi la cual es propia viene realizando esta actividad hace mas de 5 años, los desafíos que enfrenta alberto es la competencia que tiene en la ciudad pero, el los enfrenta levantándose un poco mas temprano para ir a trabajar y ganar un poco mas de dinero, el ´préstamo que esta solicitando es para darle mantenimiento a unidad de transporte, cambiar cadenas y hacer unos arreglos en los asientos de la moto taxi, el sueño que tiene alberto es con el tiempo compra un auto para darlo en alquiler, y así le genere mas ingresos, alberto esta muy agradecido con el apoyo que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Alberto is 60 years old and he lives alone. He has 2 grown-up and economically independent children. Alberto drives his own moto taxi*, an activity he has been engaged in for more than 5 years. Competition in the city is the challenge Alberto has to face, but he tackles it by getting up a little earlier to go to work, thus earning a little more money. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for maintenance works on his vehicle, such as changing the chains and having the moto taxi seats repaired. Alberto dreams with buying a car in the future, in order to rent it out and thus make more money. Alberto is deeply thankful for the support he is being given.

<cite>*A “moto taxi” is a motorcycle with a tricycle-like attachment.</cite>

loans.use: To buy chains and to have the moto taxi seats repaired.

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es:
Maria Fidelina tiene 29 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos que son solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  BELLAVISTA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Papauco Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 11 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y otras actividades.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz, además se dedica hacer fletes en una camioneta de su propiedad. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es tener casa propia  y comprar mas terreno para aumentar la produccion.

Le gusta tejer, viajar y bailar.
texts.en:
Maria Fidelina is 29 years old, married, and lives with her husband and single children in the canton of Guaranda in Bolivar Province.   

The members of the Bellavista Communal Bank are from the community of Papauco Pucara, Guanujo Parish, in the canton of Guaranda.  This community is 15 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose.  There are 11 members of the Communal Bank and they engage in agriculture, raising animals, and other activities.  

Maria is a farmer who grows potatoes, wheat, and corn.  In addition, she rents out a truck that she owns.  She purchases her supplies at the market in Guaranda and sells her products at the wholesale market in the same city.  

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her crops.  With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies.  Among the challenges she faces are pests and diseases.  Her dreams are to have a home of her own and to buy more land so that she can increase production.  

Maria enjoys knitting, traveling, and dancing.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC  AYLLU”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Huanchac en la Provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; la socia tiene 66 años D. edad, la socia es viuda, La socia tiene 4 hijos independientes todos; La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia se dedica a la venta D. comida casera, la socia desea invertir en la compra D. insumos para la elaboración D. comidas típicas y caseras, la socia comprar al por mayor, arroz, azúcar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. insumos.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Introducing Juana, a member of “SUMAC AYLLU”, a Communal Bank located in the Huanchac district, in the Cusco province and department.

Juana is 66 years old, she is a widow and she has 4 children, all economically independent- She is a retailer and she sells homemaD. food. She wants to invest in the purchase of ingredients to prepare typical and homemaD. meals. She will buy rice and sugar at wholesale price, and she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients.

She is thankful for the support she will receive, and she commits to complying with fully repaying her dues.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 46 años, convive con Juan de 47 años, y fruto de esta relación tiene 2 hijos waldir de 18 y yesenia  de 14 quienes son el motivo de sus grandes esfuerzos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de puerto mayo del distrito de Pichari. Desde que era niña, María le gustaba ayudar a sus padres en los quehaceres que lo encomendaban, pero cuando sus padres tuvieron una fuerte caída económica, María tuvo que dejar los estudios y dedicarse a los negocios, de esta manera logró contribuir con los gastos de la casa y poco a poco salir adelante. Hoy tiene una tienda de abarrotes y ratifica que aprendió muchas cosas de sus padres, como a estar preparado en lo momentos más difíciles, es por ello que siempre es precavida en las decisiones que toma con respecto a su negocio. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja, pero usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que ella se compromete a ser puntual el pago de sus cuotas. María esta satisfecha por el trabajo que realiza en su banco comunal. Con los 3.000 nuevos soles incrementara más productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite y productos enlatados para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en: María is 46 years old, she lives with her partner Juan, aged 47, and they have 2 children, Waldir, 18 and Yesenia, 14, who are the reason behind their efforts. They all live in their own house in Puerto Mayo, a community of the Pichari district. Since she was a child, María liked helping her parents with the tasks they commended to her, but when her parents suffered a serious economic loss, María had to abandon school and star working, thus contributing to the family expenses and little by little helping the family getting by. Today she runs a grocery store, and she comments that she has learnt many things from her parents, such as being prepared in the most difficult times: this is why she is always cautious when taking decisions about her activity. She usually works alone, though occasionally her partner helps her. This is her second loan with MFP, and she commits to being punctual in the repayment of her dues. María is satisfied with the job done by her communal bank. The 3.000 PEN she is requesting will be used to buy more products such as rice, sugar, oil, and canned products to supply her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, and canned products to supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Manuela

texts.es:
Maria Manuela tiene 24 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos que son solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  BELLAVISTA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Papauco Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 11 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y otras actividades.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz, además tiene 5 cabezas de ganado. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta pasear y festejar el carnaval.
texts.en:
Maria Manuela is 24 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has two children.

The members of the Bellavista Community Bank live in Papauco Pucara community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton, 15 minutes from our offices.  This bank has 11 members who farm, raise animals and carry out other business activities.

María is a farmer who grows potatoes, wheat and corn.  She also owns 5 head of livestock.  She makes her purchases in Guaranda market and makes her sales in the wholesale market in the same town.

María is requesting this loan to buy supplies and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to own her own home.

María enjoys going for walks and celebrating Carnival.

loans.use: to buy supplies and feed for her animals

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander, tiene la edad de 45 años, está casado, tiene 2 hijos  y vive con ellos y su esposa que son sus prioridades. El pretende con el dinero realizar la compra de los insumos necesarios para la asistencia del café. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación apta para este cultivo y lo que quiere es repoblar es cafetal para aumentar su producción este próximo año. El piensa en el bienestar de sus hijos y  su señora. El pretende con esta mejora obtener ganancias para salir adelante con su proyecto cafetalero. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alexander is 45 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children who are his highest priorities. He intends to use this loan to purchase necessary supplies for maintaining his coffee crop. Alexander has land that is suitable for growing this type of crop and wants to replant his coffee plantation so that he can increase production for next year. He thinks about the welfare of his wife and children and intends to improve his earnings by being successful with this coffee project.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Alexander has not had any previous loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for his coffee crop.

loans.name: German Ovidio

texts.es:
German Ovidio tiene 22 años, es soltero vive con los padres en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  BELLAVISTA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Papauco Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 11 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y otras actividades.

German se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz, además tiene un taxi. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos .Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
German Ovidio is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  

The members of the Bellavista community bank live in Papauco Pucara community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton, 15 minutes from our office.  The members of this bank farm, raise animals and carry out other business activities.

German is a farmer who grows potatoes, wheat and corn.  He also owns a taxi.  He makes his purchases in Guaranda market and makes his sales in the wholesale market in the same town.

German is requesting this loan to buy supplies.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  His dream is to own his own home.

German enjoys the Carnival fiestas.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Angelica Eustaquia

texts.es:
Angélica es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos (5 independientes).  Estudió hasta 5to de primaria.
Junto a su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de animales domésticos como vacuno y ovinos, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres ciclos.  Su primer préstamo invirtió en su negocio de venta de animales.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará cuatro ovinos para su respectivo engorde por 15 días  a un mes, para luego venderlo a buen precio.  Nos cuenta que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Su sueño es tener una vaca lechera la cual le permita generar otras ganancias.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y el compartir con las socias.
texts.en:
Angélica is a member of the "Santa Rosa de San José" community bank which is located in Mañazo district, in Puno province and department.  She is 57 years old, married, and has six children (five of whom live independently).  She studied up to the fifth year of elementary school.

Together with her husband, Angélica buys and sells animals such as cattle and sheep.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three loan cycles.  She invested her first loan in her animal sales business.

Angélica will use this new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy four sheep which she will fatten for two weeks to one month and then sell at a good procie.  She tells us that her husband is a farmer.

Angélica's dream is to own a dairy cow which would allow her to make other profits.  What she enjoys about her community bank are the meetings and sharing with her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy four sheep to fatten

loans.name: Las Fresitas De Dolores Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "LAS FRESITAS DE DOLORES" LA SEÑORA EULALIA ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO, SU GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 8 PERSONAS TODOAS ELLAS MUY DEDICADAS A SUS TRABAJOS. SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN HIDALDO EN MÉXICO. UNA DE LAS ATRACCIONES MAS IMPORTANTES QUE TIENE LA COMUNIDAD ES EL 2 DE FEBRERO DONDE SE HACE UNA FIESTA MUY GRANDE Y SE FESTEJA A LA VIRGEN DE LA CANDELARIA. LA SEÑORA EULALIA TIENE 42 AÑOS, ESTUDIO LA PRIMARIA, ES CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS, 2 HOMBRES Y UNA MUJER. SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA INTERIOR PARA DAMA, SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN ROPA INTERIOR Y COMPRAR EN MAYOREO YA QUE ASI LE ES MÁS ECONOMICA, SUS CLIENTAS LA PREFIEREN POR QUE TIENE DE TODAS LAS TALLAS, MODELOS, COLORES Y LOS PAGOS SON MUY ACCESIBLES. CON LAS GANANCIAS QUE OBTENGA QUIERE AHORRAR PARA CONTINUAR INVIRTIENDO EN SU NEGOCIO Y APOYAR A SU ESPOSO EN LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES Y EN LA EDUCACIÓN DE SUS HIJOS.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Fresitas de Dolores".  Eulalia is the group's president.  Her group has eight members who are all very committed to their work.  The group is located in Hidalgo, Mexico.  One of the most important attractions of their community is the big fiesta which is held on the 2nd of February, when they celebrate the Virgin of Candelaria.

Eulalia is 42 years old.  She completed elementary school, is married, and has three children (two sons and one daughter).  Her business is selling ladies' underwear.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying underwear wholesale since it is cheaper.  Her customers are loyal to her business because she offers all sizes, styles and colors and her payments are very affordable.  She would like to save the profits that she makes so that she can continue investing in her business and support her husband in covering their family expenses and paying for their children's education.

loans.use: to invest in buying underwear wholesale

loans.name: Maria Lucinda

texts.es:
Maria Lucinda tiene 31 años, es divorsicada vive con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  BELLAVISTA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Papauco Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 11 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y otras actividades.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz, en tierras de los padres. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos .Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta las fiestas del carnaval y tejer ropa de lana
texts.en:
Maria Lucinda is 31 years old and divorced.  She lives with her children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.

The members of the Bellavista community bank live in Papauco Pucara community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton, 15 minutes from our office.  The group has eleven members who farm, raise livestock and carry out other business activities.

María is a farmer who grows potatoes, wheat and corn on her parents' land.  She makes her purchases in Guaranda market and makes her sales in the wholesale market in the same town.

María is requesting this loan to buy supplies.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  Her dream is to own her own home.

María enjoys the Carnival fiestas and knitting clothes.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Sida Group

texts.fr:
Mme Pauline représente le groupe SIDA. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 8ans et le moins âgé a 4ans. Un va à l’école et elle a 2 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des céréales depuis 3ans. Mme s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants (TITA, TOE, LEO).Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter un sac de maïs; un demi sac de petit mil; un demi sac d’arachide; et un demi sac d’haricot.

Elle aide son mari dans les charges familiales et économise un peu. Ses ambitions sont d’agrandir son commerce (prendre des tonnes de céréales) et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Pauline represents the group SIDA. She is married and the mother of two children. The eldest is 8 years old, and the youngest is 4. One of them goes to school. 

Pauline has two persons to support. She has been selling grains for three years. She gets her supplies from surrounding villages (TITA, TOE, LEO). Her customers are men and women.

She wants to buy a sack of corn and a half-sack each of: pearl millet, peanuts, and beans. She helps out her husband with family expenses and saves a bit of money. Her ambitions include expanding her business (grains by the tonne) and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a sack of corn, a half-sack of pearl millet, a half-sack of peanuts, and a half-sack of beans

loans.name: Nieves Eusebia

texts.es:
Nieves es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia Puno y departamento Puno, tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos, todos independientes. Estudió hasta 3ro de primaria.
Desde hace un ciclo que trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo anterior fue de  S/. 400.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio de compra y venta de animales  caseros.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 600.00 nuevo soles, comprará tres animales para su respectivo engorde.  La señora trabaja sola en el negocio y la carne la vende en la localidad de Juliaca, a veces,  dice que  vende animales en su misma casa.
Su sueño es tener más ganados y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y las charlas.
texts.en:
Nieves is a member of the "Santa Rosa de San José" community bank, located in the district of Mañazo, in Puno province and Puno department.  She is 57 years old, and a single mother of 5 children, all of whom are independent.  She studied up to the 3rd grade.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for one lending cycle.  Her previous loan was for 400 New Soles, money which increased the capital of her business, which is buying and selling household animals.  With this new loan of 600 New Soles, she will buy three animals for fattening. The Señora works alone in the business and sells the meat in the town of Juliaca.  Sometime, she says, she sells animals from her home.

Her dream is to have more cattle and thus improve her income.  What she likes about the community bank is the ease of getting a loan and the lectures.

loans.use: to buy three animals.

loans.name: Basilica Antonia

texts.es: La Señora Basilica Antonia tiene 68 años. Se dedica a la actividad económica de una pulpería. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que por medio de su familia fue que obtuvo este negocio y ahora su interés es seguir con este medio de supervivencia. Basilica es una mujer muy luchadora a pesar de la edad que posee, es una mujer que le gusta este tipo negocio. Sus propósitos para su negocio son de invertir lo suficiente para que mantener a sus clientes ya que es la única que posee pulpería bien surtida. Este el motivo por el cual solicita financiamiento destinado para comprar golosinas, pan, refrescos naturales, gaseosas, granos básicos, enlatados y papel higiénico.
texts.en:
Basilica Antonia is 68 years old, and she has a grocery store.  She has devoted herself to this business for over nine years.  She got this business through her family.  Now she is interested in continuing with this way of making a living.

Basilica is a very tenacious woman despite her age.  She is a woman who likes this type of business.  Her intention for the business is to invest enough to keep her customers because she is the only one that has a well-stocked grocery store.

That is why she is requesting a loan to buy sweets, natural soft drinks, basic grains, canned goods, and toilet paper.

loans.use: to buy sweets, natural soft drinks, basic grains, canned goods, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Patricio German

texts.es:
Patricio German tiene 22 años, es soltero vive con los padres y los hermanos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  BELLAVISTA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Papauco Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 11 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y otras actividades.

Patricio se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz, además trabaja como chofer en un carro de un vecino. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar ganado y tener terrenos propios.

Le gusta visitar a los familiares.
texts.en:
Patricio German is 22 years old and single.  He lives with his parents and siblings in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province.  The members of the Bellavista Communal Bank are located in the Papauco Pucara community, Guanujo parish, Guaranda canton.  It is 15 minutes from Cooperative’s office.  This communal bank is comprised of 11 members who devote themselves to agriculture, raising animals, and other business activities.

Patricio grows potatoes, wheat, and corn.  He also works as a driver in one of his neighbor’s cars.  He makes his purchases at the Guaranda market.  He sells at the wholesale market in the same city.

He is requesting the loan to buy supplies for his crops.  The support of the loan will help him financially so that he can fulfill his needs.  He faces challenges like pest infestations, diseases, and climate changes.

His dream is to buy livestock and to have his own farmland. 

He likes to visit his relatives.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the crops.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Blanca Rosa tiene 22 años, es soltera vive con los padres , en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  BELLAVISTA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Papauco Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 11 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y otras actividades.

Blanca se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es tener un vehiculo.

Le gusta pasear y festejar las fiestas.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosa is 22 years old and single.  She lives with her parents in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province.  The members of the Bellavista Communal Bank are located in the Papauco Pucara community, Guanujo parish, Guaranda canton.  It is 15 minutes from Cooperative’s office.  This communal bank is comprised of 11 members who devote themselves to agriculture, raising animals, and other business activities.

Blanca grows potatoes, wheat, and corn.  She makes her purchases at the Guaranda market.  She sells at the wholesale market in the same city.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies for her crops.  The support of the loan will help her financially so that she can fulfill her needs.  She faces challenges like pest infestations, diseases, and climate changes.

Her dream is to have a vehicle.

She likes to take walks and celebrate holidays.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia de 42 años, es madre soltera quien tiene 4 hijos con quien vive en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de puerto mayo del distrito de Pichari. Celia es una mujer con mucho talento, ella desde el día en que se divorcio de su marido supo valorarse mucho. Con las mismas ganas que lo caracteriza decidió incursionar en la actividad agrícola, específicamente en la producción y comercialización de cacao. A ella siempre le ha gustado respetar la calidad de su producto antes que todo, es por ello que ya tiene compradores potenciales bien ganados. Su forma de trabajo es consecuencia de mucha dedicación en su terreno de cultivo, donde le dedica 10 horas diarias, solo que los días domingos se da un descanso para que este con su familia. Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con sus hijos pero ocasionalmente tiene a cargo de sus peones cuando es temporada de cosecha. Normalmente su producto los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad. Por otro lado tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde son sus hijos quienes se hacen cargo de dicho negocio. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Ella agradece a su banco comunal por el trabajo transparente que ellos realizan. Con los 1.500 soles podrá invertirlo en el cultivo de cacao, donde comprará semillas y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Celia, aged 42, is a single mother with four children with whom she lives in her own home.  She lives in the community of Puerto Mayo, in the district of Pichari.  

Celia is a very talented woman, who has been able to appreciate many things since the day she and her husband divorced.  With the same enthusiasm that characterizes her, she decided to enter farming, in particular the production and selling of cocoa.  She has always liked to focus on the quality of her product first and foremost, which is why she has already earned potential buyers.  

Her work is the result of much dedication to her farming land where she spends 10 hours a day; it is only on Sundays that she has a break to be with her family.  She usually works together with her children, but occasionally she is in charge of her workers when it is harvest season.  She normally sells her product in the collection centers in her area. On the other hand, she has a small grocery store where her children are in charge of the business. 

This is her second loan through MFP, and she is committed to being prompt in paying her repayments.  She appreciates her community bank for the transparent work they do.  With the 1,500 Soles, she would be able to invest in her cocoa cultivation by buying seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy cocoa seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Maria Rosa tiene 35 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  BELLAVISTA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Papauco Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 11 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y otras actividades.

Maria  se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz y el esposo se dedica a la albañeria para auentar los ingresos en terrenos de los padres. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es tener terrenos y casa propia.

Le gusta las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Maria Rosa is 35 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the Canton Guaranda Privince of Bolivar.

The members of the V.R.C. Bellavista are located in the Papauco Pucara Parroquia Guanujo community, Guaranda settlement at a distance of 15 minutes from the office of the cooperative. This location has 11 members that work in agriculture, animal raising, and other activities.

Maria works in agriculture sowing potatoes, wheat, and corn. Her husband works as a bricklayer to increase the income in the parents' land. The purchases are made in the Guaranda market and she sells them in the wholesale market in the same city.

She is asking for the loan to buy fertilizers for the crops. With the support of the loan, she would be helped economically to supply her needs and face challenges like plagues and illnesses. Her dream is to have plots of land and a house of her own.

She likes the carnaval holildays.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Paulina Leonila

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos (1 independiente).  Estudió hasta 2do de secundaria.
Se dedica a la venta de granos de la Región como quinua, chuño y  papa, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.000 nuevo soles,  dinero que invirtió en su negocio, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 600.00 nuevo soles,  aumentará al capital de su negocio y comprará cuatro arrobas de chuño, tunta (papa procesada),  cuatro arrobas de quinua.  Nos cuenta que los compra en Juliaca y los vende en el mercado de  Mañazo.
Trabaja sola en el negocio ya que su esposo trabaja en la mina.
Su sueño es tener más capital que le permita crecer como empresaria y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, la capacitación y las orientaciones que imparte la Promotora.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Communal Bank "Santa Rosa de San José", which is located in the distict of Mañazo, province and department Puno. She is 38 years old. She lives with her partner and has 3 children (1 is independent). She studied through the 2nd level of high school.
She sells grains from the region such as quinoa, potato flour and potatoes. Her first loan was for S/. 500.000 nuevo soles. She invested the money in her business. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for one year.
With this new loan of S/ 600.00 nuevo soles, she will enlarge the capital of her business and will buy four arrobas (unit of weight between 11 and 16 kilograms) of potato flour, tunta (processed potato), and four arrobas of quinoa. She tells us that she will buy them in Juliaca and sell them in the market of Mañazo.
She works alone in the business since her husband works in the mine.
Her dream is to have more money which will allow her to grow as a buisiness woman and that her children become professionals.
What she likes about the communal banks is the punctuality, the training, and the orientations that Promotora gives.

loans.use: to buy potato flour, tunta (processed potato), and quinoa.

loans.name: Angela Daysi

texts.es: Ángela Daysi tiene 61 años. Por lo que no es la primera experiencia que ha tenido con los financiamientos. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de textil y vestuario. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella desde muy joven ha trabajado, ella confecciona todo tipo de prendas de vestir y también por encargo la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan diferentes pedidos  y algunas empresas que acuden por sus servicios. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de telas, gorras, zipper, bolsos, botones, hilos entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Ángela Daysi is 61 years old. This is not the first experience she has had with financing. The economic activity she makes a living at is the sale of textiles and apparel. 

It has been more than 30 years since she began making a living at this business. She has worked worked since she was quite young. She makes all kinds of garments and the majority of her customers make a variety of custom requests and some businesses turn to her for her services. 

She is requesting this loan for working capital to purchase textiles, caps, zippers, bags, buttons and thread among other products.

loans.use: to buy textiles, caps, zippers, bags, buttons and thread among other products.

loans.name: Rode Betsaida

texts.es:
Rode Betsaida es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Tiene grado de instrucción secundaria.
La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, se dedica  a la compra/venta y engorde de animales domésticos.
Ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementará a su capital para el alquiler de pastos por hectáreas para el engorde de los animales vacunos y ovinos.
En el negocio  trabaja junto a su esposo, quien trabaja en construcción civil.
Su sueño es vender abarrotes en las ferias de la localidad y tener movilidad propia para el traslado de la mercadería.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad entre las socias.
texts.en:
Rode Betsaida is a member of the “Santa Rosa de San José” communal bank, which is located in the district of Mañazo, in the province and department of Puno. She is 24 years old and has a common-law husband and one child. She has completed secondary school. 

She is a new member who recently joined the Manuela Ramos Movement organization. She works buying, fattening and selling farm animals. 

She needs a loan for 500.00 Peruvian new soles, which she will use to increase her capital by renting grazing lands by the hectare, in order to fatten up her cattle and sheep. 

In her business, she works together with her husband, who works in civil construction. 

Her dream is to sell groceries at the local markets and to have her own vehicle to transport her merchandise. 

What she likes about her communal bank is the punctuality and responsibility shown by the members.

loans.use: to rent grazing lands to feed her livestock.

loans.name: David Javier

texts.en: David lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras, where he operates a small food business. He prepares fresh food from 7 in the morning until 10 at night, and has run the business for several years. David is requesting a loan of Lps. 15,000 with which to buy ingredients for cooking. He is very grateful for the support he has received from Prisma and hopes to continue growing his business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, sausages, chicken, corn meal, corn, tomatoes, lettuce, beans, rice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Irma, quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas y vecinas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, ya que había oído hablar muy bien de ese programa y quisieron todas juntas aventurarse.
La Sra. Irma esta casada con el Sr. Julio hace 17 años. Ella se dedica a la venta y producción de productos de limpieza. Gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y a sus hijos. Ella sueña con algún día poder abrir una mercería donde poder vender todo tipo de artículos.
Ella se define como una mujer muy luchadora, siempre ha trabajado y no tiene miedo de hacerlo. Manifiesta que todo el trabajo que realiza lo hace para evitar que sus hijos pasen por las mismas necesidades que ella ha tenido que sobrellevar.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de los ingredientes a utilizar para la producción de los artículos de limpieza, como ser las esencias, los colorantes, jabones líquidos, aromatizantes y demás.
texts.en:
The contact for the founding of this committee was Irma, who invited and organized her friends and neighbors to form part of the Entrepreneurial Women's Committee program, since she had heard many good things about this program, and all of them wanted to give it a try together. 

Irma has been married to Julio for 17 years. She works producing and selling cleaning products. Thanks to this work, she has been able to help her family and her children get ahead. She dreams that one day she will be able to open a general store where she can sell all types of items. 

She defines herself as a very determined woman; she has always worked and she isn't afraid of doing so. She reports that all of the work she has done has been aimed at ensuring that her children never face the same lack of necessities that she had to endure. 

She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients that she will use to produce cleaning products, such as essences, colorings, liquid soaps, fragrances and others.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to produce cleaning supplies, such as essences, colorings, liquid soaps, fragrances and others.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Del Divino Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
El comité se encuentra formado en la ciudad de Villa Elisa. El grupo está conformado por doce integrantes, todas ellas madres, jefas de familia. El comité se formó gracias a la unión de las señoras que son todas vecinas y también comparten actividades comunitarias en un grupo religioso de la zona.
Ellas se demuestran como personas confiables, alegres y con ganas de salir adelante en pos del mejoramiento de su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Así también, se muestran felices por formar parte del programa “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras”.
La Sra. Perla se dedica a la costura hace ya varios años. Ella ha formado ya una clientela bien definida en u barrio. Gracias e este trabajo ella ha logrado mantener a su familia y brindarles una vida un poco alejada de las privaciones. Ella desea algun dia poder ampliar su pequeño taller de trabajo.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de los materiales necesarios para el ejercicio de su profesión, consistente en hilos, y sets de agujas para continuar con la costura.
texts.en:
The committee was formed and is located in the city of Villa Elisa. The group is made up of twelve members all of whom are mothers and heads of household. The committee was formed thanks to the unity of the women that are all neighbors and also share in community activities through a religious group in the region. 

They have shown themselves to be reliable and cheerful people with the desire to get ahead in pursuit of a better quality of life for themselves and for their families. They also seem happy to be a part of the “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras” [Committee of Entrepreneurial Women] group.

Señora Perla has made a living as a dressmaker for several years now. She has developed a well-defined clientele in her neighborhood. Thanks to this work she has been able to support her family and provide them with a life outside of hardship. One day she would like to be able to expand her small workshop.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of the necessary materials for her profession, consisting of thread and needle sets to continue with her dressmaking.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials for the practice of her profession consisting of thread, needle sets and more.

loans.name: San Salvador Group

texts.es:
El comité se formo gracias a la iniciativa de unas vecinas de la ciudad de San Ignacio, fue una reunión de  amigas que al oír del programa mujeres emprendedoras decidieron organizarse para formar un comité. Actualmente el comité denominado San Salvador esta integrado por doce mujeres, las cuales trabajan de forma responsable, unida y solidaria. Todas ellas se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras para que por medio del trabajo conjunto puedan llevar un ingreso a sus casas para la ayuda a su familia.
La Sra luz tiene una pequeña peluquería en la que atiende a todos sus clientes desde hace ya varios años. Ella por medio de su trabajo ha podido ayudar a su familia para poder darles un sustento digno, sin hacerles faltar lo básico. Ella sueña algún día poder ampliar su pequeña peluquería y así poder atender a mas clientes.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de implemento para su peluquería como ser ruleros, secadores, planchitas, gel y demás. Ella sabe que el credito le sera de mucha utilidad, y por eso tiene sus esperanzas puestas en el prestamos.
texts.en:
The group was formed thanks to the initiative of one of the members from the city of San Ignacio. It was at a friends' gather that she heard about the program for entrepreneurial women that they decided to organize themselves and to form a group. Today, the name of the group is San Salvador and it is made up of twelve women, all of whom work in a responsible, unified, and group-oriented way. They all came together to help each other out so that with a group effort they might earn an income to bring home for the support of their family. 

Luz has a small beauty salon where she has been attending her clients for many years now. It is through her business that she has been able to help her family and to provide them with dignity and support, to provide for their basic needs. She dream of expanding her small hair salon some day to be able to attend more clients. She requests a loan to purchase implements for her salon, such as rolls, dryers, irons, hair gel, and other products. She knows that this loan will be very useful to her and for this reason she has her hopes on getting a loan.

loans.use: to purchase implements for her salon, such as rolls, dryers, irons, hair gel, and other products.

loans.name: Helmer

texts.en: Helmer lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras, where he has operated a small convenience shop for the last 10 years. His business has enjoyed modest success over the years due to its strategic location in an area with high foot traffic. Helmer is requesting a loan of Lps.15,000 with which to buy merchandise for his store. He is very grateful to Prisma for their support and hopes to continue growing his business.

loans.use: to purchase meats, cheeses, fruits, vegetables, snacks, beverages, basic grains, salt, butter, cooking oil, basic household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Yenis Gezabel

texts.en:
Yenis lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras where she runs a small pig farm as well as selling baked goods and soft drinks. She wakes each morning to tend to the pigs she raises as well as bake a local snack called "rosquilla" that is made from cornmeal. 

Yenis is requesting a loan of Lps. 15,000 with which to purchase cornmeal, soft drinks, and pigs, all of which will be used in her eclectic business.

loans.use: to purchase cornmeal, yeast, soft drinks, and pigs.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Luchadoras” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano R. Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité trabajan activamente en un ambiente de cooperación y respeto hacia las demás.
Ellas se unieron con el propósito de llevar a sus casas un mayor ingreso y proveerles a sus familias una vida decorosa y sin privaciones como ellas tuvieron que pasar.
La Señora Rosa es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a las ventas de bebidas en su domicilio. ella se dedica a esto hace mucho tiempo, por lo mismo ya tiene una clientela bien definida. Manifiesta que los fines de semana es cuando mas ventas tiene, y por lo general sus mercaderías no dan abasto a la demandas. Ella sueña con algún día ampliar su negocio y poder llenar mas su local.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas bebidas para su local, tales como whiskys, gaseosas, cervezas, energizantes, jugos y demás. Ella tiene las esperanzas puestas en el credito ya que le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The group named "Mujeres Luchadoras", meaning "Overcoming Women", was formed through a union of several neighbors in the city of Mariano R. Alonso. All of the members of the group actively work in a cooperative environment and in a mutually respectful way. 

They came together with the goal of earning a better income for their households in order to provide their families with a decent life, not having to deprive themselves and they once had to. 

Rosa is one of the members of the group. She sells drinks from her home. She has had her business for some time, which is why she has a well established client base. She says that she gets the most business on the weekends and most often her merchandise is not enough to meet the demands. She dreams of expanding her business some day and to have a better inventory for her store.

She requests a loan to purchase more drinks for her store, such as whisky, soft drinks, beer, energy drinks, juices, and others. She has her hopes set on getting a loan which will be a great source of help.

loans.use: to purchase whisky, soft drinks, beer, energy drinks, juices, and others.

loans.name: Palo Herrado Ii Group

texts.en:
Liliam, Ana Rosa, and Santos, all of whom reside in the Choluteca region of Honduras, formed the “Palo Herrado” solidarity group in June, 2011. 

Liliam has worked as a seamstress for several years and produces uniforms for a number of local schools. Liliam is requesting a loan of Lps. 4,000 to purchase fabric, thread, buttons, and zippers that will be used in her seamstress business. 

Ana Rosa runs a small chicken farm and Santos runs a small business selling new clothing.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, buttons, zippers, pins, sewing needles, and thread.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elia Maria

texts.es: Elia Maria tiene 69 años, ella tiene muchas experiencias de trabajar con financiamientos, pues ha demostrado ser una mujer muy capaz, siempre ha realizado el pago de sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Hace más de 33 años que se dedica a este negocio y ha logrado crecer pues ella está muy agradecida por esta oportunidad que le han brindado. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas, ella se levanta temprano desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, todos los días sus tortillas son muy famosas por sus clientes que siempre llegan a comprar este producto. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de maíz, cal, leña, comal, bolsas y carbón. Su deseo es ampliar su local y brindar mejoras para su vivienda.
texts.en: Elia Maria is 69 years old and she has much experience in working with loans. She has demonstrated herself to be a capable woman, always having made her payments on time and in form. She has been in business for more than 33 years and she has managed to develop it. She is very thankful for this opportunity which is presented to her. Her business activity is the sale and production of tortillas. She starts her day very early, working from 5 in the morning until 6 in the evening, every day. Her tortillas are very famous and her clients always come to purchase her product. The loan which she requests is to purchase corn, lime, firewood, a grill, plastic bags, and charcoal. Her goal is to expand her store and to make some home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase corn, lime, firewood, a grill, plastic bags, and charcoal.

loans.name: Damas Del Barrio San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El comite denominado Damas del Barrio San Antonio, nace gracias a la iniciativa de la Sra Blanca, ella organizó a sus vecinas y amigas y les contó sobre el programa de mujeres emprendedoras, ellas quedaron encantadas al oír sobre el programa y decidieron organizarse en el comité. Actualmente el comité cuenta con 15 integrantes, todas ellas trabajan de forma conjunta y responsable. Su fin primordial es la obtención de mayores ingresos para la ayuda a sus familias, así como a ellas mismas.
La Sra. Deolinda tiene una pequeña despensa, por medio del cual sostiene a su familia, brinda el pan de cada día y brinda a sus hijos lo mínimo que necesitan para una vida decorosa. Ella desea algún día, poder ampliar su negocio y así generar mas ingresos.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de comestibles, enlatados, cernes, y demás para el abastecimiento de su local.
texts.en:
The committee named “Damas del Barrio San Antonio” (Women of San Antonio Neighborhood) was started as a result of the efforts of Sra. Blanca. She organized her friends and neighbors and informed them about the Program of Women Entrepreneurs. They were happy to hear about the program and decided to organize a committee. There are currently 15 members in the committee. All of them work responsibly and in a cooperative manner. Their primary purpose is to generate more income to help their families and themselves.

Sra. Deolinda has a small store that helps to sustain her family, provide for their daily needs, and give her children the minimum necessities to have a decent life. Someday she hopes to expand her business so that she can generate more income. She is requesting a loan to buy food products, canned goods, meats, and other items to restock her store.

loans.use: to purchase food products, canned goods, meats, and other items.

loans.name: Elibeth

texts.es:
Elibeth es vecina de Mollejones de Pérez Zeledón, ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo.
En este momento Elibeth quiere aprovechar que los precios del café a nivel nacional han subido, y es por eso que ella quiere un préstamo de ₡600 000 (Seiscientos mil colones) para la compra de todos los insumos que ella necesita para hacer un almacigo con el que sembrara media hectárea de café.
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Bancruce, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Elibeth is a resident of Mollejones de Pérez Zeledón. She is a woman who is extremely dedicated to her work. At the moment, Elibeth wants to take advantage of rising coffee prices across the nation. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 600,000 CRC so that she can buy all the supplies she needs to establish a seedbed. She plans to sow one-half hectare of coffee.

Elibeth is a member of the Bancruce Communal Credit Enterprise, one of the 110 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for planting coffee.

loans.name: Angel Adolfo

texts.en:
Angel lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras where he operates a small eatery. He has enjoyed success due to his business’ convenient location in the village center, as well as the quality of his food. 

Angel wakes each day at five in the morning to begin preparing local dishes for his customers. He is requesting a loan of Lps. 20,000 to purchase ingredients that will be used in food preparation.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, sausages, chicken, cornmeal, corn, tomatoes, lettuce, beans, rice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mujeres Loma Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Loma se ha formado gracias al entusiasmo de las vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Caacupé, ellas oyeron hablar del programa de mujeres emprendedoras y se propusieron formar un comité. Actualmente cuenta con 15 miembros, todas las miembros trabajan arduamente para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La Sra. Cyntia, se dedica a la elaboración y posterior venta de panificados. Ella, con la ayuda de su marido todos los días preparan panes frescos para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Trabajan todos los días, sin excepción de domingos ni feriados.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de harinas, huevos, levaduras y demás especias que podría necesitar para la elaboración de sus panificados. Ella manifiesta que esta muy esperanzada en el credito, puesto que le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The committee named “Mujeres Loma” was started as a result of some enthusiastic friends and neighbors from the city of Caacupé. They heard about the Program of Women Entrepreneurs and proposed to form a committee. There are currently 15 members. All of them work hard so that they can help one another.

Sra. Cyntia prepares and sells baked goods. She and her husband prepare fresh bread each day to offer to their customers. They work every day, with the exception of Sundays and holidays.

She is requesting a loan to buy flour, eggs, yeast, and certain spices that she needs for preparing her baked goods. Cyntia says that she is very hopeful that this loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, yeast, and spices.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El comité San Miguel se formo entre un grupo de vecinas y amigas de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo. Escucharon hablar sobre el programa de mujeres emprendedoras y decidieron agruparse y formar su propio comité.
Actualmente cuenta con 18 miembros, todas ellas trabajan de forma ardua y responsable. Son mujeres jefas de familia que deciden ir en busca del pan de cada día para sus hijos y su familia.
La Sra. Maria se dedica a la producción y venta de alimentos, ella tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado. Ella se levanta a muy tempranas horas de la mañana y se dirige a su puesto de trabajo para elaborar y luego vender los alimentos que ella realiza. Quiere, algún día poder agrandar su pequeño puesto para poder así tener mas clientes.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de todo lo que necesita para la elaboración de sus alientos como ser la carne, pollo, hortalizas, aceite, huevos y demás. Tiene fe de que por medio del credito podrá aumentar los insumos que tiene.
texts.en:
The San Miguel Committee was formed by a group of neighbors and friends from the city of San Lorenzo. They heard about the Program of Women Entrepreneurs and decided to gather together to form their own committee. There are currently 18 members. All of them work hard and responsibly. These female heads of household decided to find a way to provide for the daily needs of their children and their families.

Sra. Maria prepares and sells food. She has a small vending post at the market. Maria wakes up early in the morning and heads to work so that she can prepare and sell her dishes. Someday she hopes to expand her small vending post so that she can accommodate more customers.

Maria is requesting a loan so that she can buy everything she needs for preparing her dishes such as meat, chicken, vegetables, oil, eggs, and other items. She has faith that this loan will help her generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, vegetables, oil, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalía es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos.  Estudió hasta 4to de  primaria.
Su primer prestamos fue de  S/. 500.000 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en  su negocio de venta de abarrotes, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres ciclos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles aumentará al capital de su negocio y comprará arroz, fideos, azúcar, leche, harina y aceite, en el negocio la ayudan sus hijos, su esposo trabaja en una mina de la zona. 
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una casa en Puno.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la  facilidad del préstamo, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de San José” which is located in the District of Mañazo, Province and Department of Puno. She is 39 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has four children. Rosalía has a fourth grade education.

Her first loan was in the amount of 500 PEN. The money was invested in her business of selling groceries. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for three loan cycles.

With this new loan of 500 PEN, Rosalía will increase the capital of her business and purchase rice, noodles, sugar, milk, flour, and oil. Her children help her with her business. Rosalía’s husband works at local mine.

Her dreams are to see her children become professionals and own a house in Puno. What she likes about the Communal Bank are the loans, the punctuality, and the responsibility.

loans.use: to purchase rice, noodles, sugar, milk, flour, and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase glue, nails, screws, aluminum, hardware, and hoses.

loans.name: Benita De Los Angeles

texts.es: Benita De Los Ángeles es madre soltera, Benita ha salido adelante con su hijo que todavía necesita de su apoyo. Ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de comida, hace más de 10 años que trabaja en este negocio, por lo que le ha ido muy bien y ha sido muy beneficioso. El sueño de Benita es tener un restaurante ya que a ella le gusta mucho cocinar, además este sería un gran negocio en su comarca. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, verduras, frutas, platos desechables, bolsas y frutas para sus refrescos.
texts.en:
Benita De Los Ángeles is a single mother who has been able to move forward with her son, but she still needs assistance. She prepares and sells food. Her business has been in existence for more than 10 years. She has done very well, which has been very beneficial. Benita’s dream is to have a restaurant since she love to cook. In addition, it would be a great business to have in the area.

She is requesting this loan to use as operating capital for buying rice, beans, oil, vegetables, disposable plates, bags, and fruits for her refreshments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, vegetables, disposable plates, bags, and fruits.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El Comite esta integrado por mujeres de la ciudad de Paraguarí. Todas ellas inicialmente se informaron con el fín de interiorizarse sobre el programa ofrecido por la Fundación Paraguaya, verificando que les será una oportunidad muy buena, por esta razón realizan una reunión para conformar el comité.
El comite lleva por nombre Kuña Guapa por estar integrada  por mujeres muy activas y emprendedoras, ellas se comprometen a   mantenerse unidas y trabajar bajo un marco de respeto mutuo que todas las integrantes se merecen, actualmente se encuentran en el  tercer ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por  15  mujeres quienes trabajan arduamente para mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia.
La Sra. Juana es artesana, ella desde pequeña se dedica a la creación de artesanías, lo cual había aprendido de su madre. Por medio de esa profesión ella ha logrado mantenerse a ella misma, como así también a su familia.
Solicita el credito para la compra de hilos y set de agujas y demás materiales para la realización de sus artesanías. Por medio del credito podrá cumplir con aquellos pedidos que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
This committee is composed of women from the city of Paraguarí. All of them initially received information so that they could learn about the program offered by Fundación Paraguaya. They verified that this would be a very good opportunity, so they decided to come together to form a committee.

This committee is named “Kuña Guapa” since it is composed of active and enterprising women. They commit to staying together and working with the understanding that all members deserve mutual respect. They are currently starting their third loan cycle with an excellent rating. The group consists of 15 women, all of whom work hard to improve their standard of living and that of their families.

Sra. Juana is an artisan who has been making crafts from a young age. She learned this trade from her mother. Through her work, she is able to support herself as well as her family. Juana is requesting a loan to buy thread, a set of needles, and other materials for making her crafts. With this loan, she will be able to complete her outstanding orders.

loans.use: to purchase thread, a set of needles, and other materials used in making crafts.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Señora Francisca tiene 61 años. Hace más de 26 años que se dedica  a venta y elaboración de atoles. Ella siempre ha buscado la forma de ganarse el alimento diario. Es una Señora con espíritu emprendedor y cada uno de sus clientes disfruta del buen humor de Francisca. En negocio lo inicio desde joven, ya que anteriormente su mama se hacía cargo de la actividad, fue con el paso del tiempo que le enseño a Francisca para que ella pudiera obtener un trabajo, fue así que ella salió adelante. El motivo del crédito es para la compra leche, queso, arroz, vasos plásticos, cucharas y tasas.  El mayor sueño que ella tiene es satisfacer la demanda de cada uno de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca is 61 years old. For more than 26 years, she has been preparing and selling “atol” (a hot beverage made from corn). She is always looking for ways to provide for her daily needs. Sra. Francisca has an enterprising spirit and each of her customers enjoys her good humor. She started working as a young woman since her mother previously was in charge of the business. As time passed, Francisca’s mother was able to teach her until she was ready to take over the business and move forward.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy milk, cheese, rice, plastic cups, spoons, and bowls. Her greatest wish is to satisfy the demand of each of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase milk, cheese, rice, plastic cups, spoons, and bowls.

loans.name: Sixta Justina

texts.es:
Sixta es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos (1 independiente).  Tiene educación secundaria completa.
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres ciclos, su primer monto solicitado fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de ganados ovinos y vacunos.  También se dedica a la confección de artesanía como chompas, chalinas y ponchos, esto lo hace en sus ratos libres.
Con éste nuevo  préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará seis animales, los compra en las comunidades del distrito y los vende en Mañazo y Puno.  En el negocio trabaja sola.  Nos dice que sus hijos estudian.
Su sueño es tener un negocio de venta de comidas el cual le permitirá tener mayores ganancias.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es el compañerismo, compartir con las socias y las charlas respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Sixta is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de San José” which is located in the District of Mañazo, Province and Department of Puno. She is 39 years old, widowed, and has four children (one of whom is independent). Sixta completed her high school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for three loan cycles. The first loan she requested was in the amount of 500 PEN. The money was invested in her business of buying and selling sheep and cattle. In addition, she produces handicrafts such as sweaters, scarves, and ponchos during her free time.

With this new loan of 1000 PEN, she will buy six animals. Sixta will buy the animals in the communities within the district and sell them in Mañazo and Puno. She works alone in her business. Her children are in school.

Her dream is to have a business selling food so that she can earn more income. What she likes about the Communal Bank are the camaraderie, sharing with the other members, and the seminars that relate to business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El Sr Oscar está casado hace más de 15 años con la sra Asunción, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y el ultimo tiene 12 años y ayuda bastante ya también en el kiosko.
Él tiene un Kiosco en su domicilio, comenta que tiene muy buena clientela gracias a que está ubicado frente a la Universidad Nacional de Coronel Oviedo. El Sr. Oscar es comerciante hace mas de 6 años y se considera una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora. Todos los días se levanta a tempranas horas para ponerse a trabajar, ya sea atendiendo en su negocio o yendo a comprar mercaderías para su local.
Solicita el credito para la compra de mas productos para ofrecer en su kiosko tales como golosinas, bebidas y demás. Ve en el credito que solicita una buena oportunidad de inversión con lo cual podrá aumentar su variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar has been married for more than 15 years to Sra. Asunción. They have three children. Two of them are already adults and the youngest is 12 years old. His youngest child helps him with his business.

Oscar has a kiosk set up in his home. He says that he has many good customers because he is located in front of the National University of Coronel Oveido. Sr. Oscar has been a merchant for more than six years and is considered to be a hardworking and determined individual. Every day he wakes up in the early hours to get ready for work, attend to his business, and purchase merchandise for his shop.

He is requesting a loan to buy more products to offer in his kiosk such as candy, beverages, and other items. Oscar sees this loan as a good investment opportunity so that he can expand the variety of products that he offers.

loans.use: to purchase candy, beverages, and other items.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos (1 independiente).  Estudió  hasta 1ro de secundaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres ciclos, su crédito anterior fue de  S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de ganados como ovinos y alpacas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará diez corderos y tres alpacas, dice que los compra y los engorda por un mes para luego venderlos a mejor precio.
En sus ratos libres se dedica al tejido de chompas, media, bordados y accesorios, esta actividad le genera algunas ganancias.
Trabaja sola en el negocio ya que su esposo trabaja en la mina.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y generar mayores ganancias.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal son los ahorros y la capacitación.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a member of the “Santa Rosa de San José” community bank located in the Mañazo district of both the province and department of Puno. She is 54 years old, is married and has four children (one is independent). She has completed the first year of secondary school education.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos [Manuela Ramos Movement] for three loan cycles. Her previous loan was for 500.00 nuevos soles. She invested the loan in her business of buying and selling livestock such as sheep and alpacas.

With this new loan for 1,500.00 nuevos soles she will buy ten lambs and three alpacas. She says that she buys them and fattens them up for a month to later sell them at a better price.

In her free time she knits sweaters, stockings, embroidered pieces and accessories. This activity makes her some extra income. She works alone in the business as her husband works in a mine. 

Her dream is to improve her business and generate more income. She likes the savings and training provided by the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy ten lambs and three alpacas.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité Oñondivepa cuenta con quince miembros. Todas ellas son amigas y vecinas D. la ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso. El comité surge a consecuencia D. que una D. las integrante oyó hablar del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras, y como les gusto mucho la idea se organizaron y D. allí surgió el comité.
Estas mujeres se denominan a ellas mismas como personas muy trabajadoras que luchan cada día por brindarles a sus familias el sustento. Ellas aseguran que todo el sacrificio es por sus hijos y familiares y quieren, para ellos,  una vida mejor D. las ellas tuvieron.
La Sra. Angelina se dedica a la venta D. ropas D. todas las estaciones, por medio D. este digno oficio ella ha podido brindarse y brindarles a sus familiares una vida decorosa. Esta orgullosa D. que por medio D. su trabajo los que dependan D. ella puedan acceder a un futuro mejor.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra D. mas ropas, para la renovación del stock, para su posterior venta. DesD. ya agradece a Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
The Oñondivepa committee has fifteen members. All of them are friends and neighbors from the town of Mariano Roque Alonso. The committee arose because one of the members had heard people talking about the program for entrepreneurial women, and since they liked the idea a lot, they organized themselves and formed the committee. 

These women describe themselves as very hard-working people who struggle each day to proviD. sustenance for their families. They affirm that all of their sacrifices are for their children and family members; they want to proviD. a better life for their families than the one they experienced. 

Angelina works selling clothing for all seasons of the year. Through this valued profession, she has been able to proviD. a decent living for herself and her family. She is proud that thanks to her work, the people who depend on her will have access to a better future. 

She is requesting the loan to buy more clothing, in order to renew her stock for future resale. She is grateful to the Paraguaya Foundation for the opportunity provided to her.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge es de la ciudad de Carapegua, tiene 21 años de edad, está casado con Corazón de Maria, quien cuenta con 18 años de edad.
Jorge tiene una tienda de reparación de teléfonos celulares donde trabaja junto con su esposa. El no tiene actualmente un local propio, sino alquilado y reside en la casa de sus suegros. Su sueño es tener algún día casa y local propios en donde poder desarrollar su actividad comercial.
El solicita el credito para la inversión en repuestos que utilizará en los teléfonos que va repara, esos repuestos son de variado tipo ya que existe una gran variedad de teléfonos. El esta con las esperanzas puestas en el credito.
texts.en:
Jorge, 21, is from the city of Carapegua, and is married to Corazón de Maria, 18.  Jorge has a store where he repairs cellular phones.  His wife works there along with him.  At this time he does not own his store; he works out of a rented location and he lives in his in-law's home.  His dream is to someday have a house and his own store where he could develop his commercial activities.

He requests a loan to invest in spare parts for phones that he will use in his repair work.  He will buy a variety of parts, since he repairs many different types of telephones.  He has high hopes for this loan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for cellular telephones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for his pigs.

loans.name: Lesbia

texts.es:
Perfil Lesbia

Monto 400000

Lesbia tiene 30 años, es de origen nicaragüense y vive en la región de Sarapiqui, Zona Norte de Costa Rica en compañía de su esposo y su hijo de 10 años. Este es el tercer crédito que solicita en Fundación Mujer.  Se desea invertir en mercadería para la temporada alta  con el objetivo de aumentar su inventario ante los pedidos de la época.
Ella vende por catálogo ropa interior y artículos del hogar; desea mantener su independencia económica y colaborar en la casa con su esposo quién trabaja en construcción en la misma zona. A su  hijo le está brindando el apoyo en el estudio actualmente cursa la primaria y ella le paga clases de computación; viven en una condición humilde por lo que la actividad contribuye económicamente a mejor la calidad de vida del grupo familiar. Uno de sus sueños es poder comprarle una computadora para que pueda seguir mejorando. Es una persona trabajadora y responsable con su hogar y sus compromisos.

En lo que respecta a su negocio  ha  construido una importante cantidad de clientes que le compran regularmente y le pagan por sus pedidos en dos pagos mensuales.  Ella inició su negocio hace 4 años con cien dólares que le dio su esposo, posterior a eso en el 2007 realizó un crédito en Fundación Mujer por un monto de 350000 colones el cual canceló sin ningún contratiempo Desea refinanciarse para adquirir mercadería de los catálogos que comercializa.

Ella trabaja a crédito con una clientela que le paga en a un mes en dos cuotas quincenales, ella paga sus facturas de contado y en esta oportunidad desea invertir en una compra importante para cubrir los pedidos de la temporada.
texts.en:
Lesbia is 30 years old, is Nicaraguan and lives in the region of Sarapiqui in Costa Rica's Northern Zone with her husband and 10 year old child. This is the third loan she has requested through Fundación Mujer (The Foundation for Women).  She wants to invest in merchandise for the busy season in order to increase her inventory prior to the orders of that period.

She sells underclothes and household goods from a catalog.  She wants to maintain her financial independence and work at home with her ​​husband who works in construction in the same area.  She is providing support for her child in his studies; he is currently attending primary school and she pays for computer classes.  They live in a humble way, so her work helps pay for a better quality of life for the family.  One of her dreams is to be able to buy a computer so she can continue to improve herself. 

Lesbia is a hard-working woman who is responsible about her home and her commitments.  As for her business, she has established a significant number of customers who buy regularly, and who pay for their orders in two monthly payments.  She started her business 4 years ago with a hundred dollars given to her by her husband.  Following that, in 2007 she took a loan through Fundación Mujer in the amount of 350,000 colones which she paid back without a hitch.  She wants to refinance to purchase merchandise from the catalogs from which she sells.

She works on credit with her customers who pay her each month in two installments every two weeks.  She pays her bills in cash and at this time wants to invest in a major purchase to cover her orders for the season.

loans.use: to sell products from two catalogs; Zermat and Nataly Princess.  She wants to acquire merchandise and count on working capital for the busy season.

loans.name: Brenda Maria

texts.es: La señora Brenda Maria, tiene 38 años es madre soltera con un hijo. Brenda tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos y ropa, este negocio empezó hace 5 años con muy poco capital  de trabajo, como una búsqueda de fuente de ingresos alternativos. Ella empezó vendiendo muy pocos cosméticos, después fue que empezó a invertir un poco más al observar que la mayoría de sus clientes le solicito variedad en productos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de lápiz labial, brillo, estuches de sombra y estuches de vanidad. Su meta es llegar a tener un una tienda de artículos variados que pueda estar ubicada en el mercado, que brinde las facilidades económicas a ella y a su hijo.
texts.en: Brenda Maria is 38 years old and a single mother with one child. Brenda has a business selling cosmetics and clothing. She started this business 5 years ago with very little working capital, in search of an alternative source of income. She began by selling small amounts of cosmetics, and later she began to invest a little more, upon observing that most of her customers were requesting a greater variety of products. The loan will be invested in buying lipstick, gloss, eye shadow sets and vanity cases. Her goal is to open a store within the local market, where she can sell a variety of items, in order to provide economic security for herself and her son.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, gloss, eye shadow sets and vanity cases.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
La señora Shirley es una mujer de 44 años de edad, vive con sus tres hijos menores de edad y su esposo, sus estudios llegaron hasta la primaria por motivos económicos, es persona muy trabajadora, emprendedora, luchadora.
Este es el segundo crédito que tiene en la Fundación, el cual su primero tuvo una excelente moral de pago, ella se dio cuenta por un programa en la televisión llamado ¨Buen Día¨   .
Doña Shirley con este préstamo invertirá el dinero en surtir su bazar, ya que vienen épocas muy buenas y necesita capital 
La señora desde hace 7 años tiene su bazar empezó con un monto de 300,000.00 colones y a la fecha  su negocio ha mejorado muchísimo. Un obstáculo que tuvo fue  no tener capital de trabajo ya que necesitaba para mantenerse.
La señora diariamente se levanta temprano alista a su hija y  los desayunos de su esposo e hijos, después ellos  van para el colegio,  y ella termina las labores domesticas, en el transcurso del día atiende el bazar.
