Her goal is to expand her business and install a photocopier. She gets up at six in the morning and does her household tasks after which she opens the shop at 8 and closes at 8. With this loan she will be able to supply her shop and have more working capital to continue working and subsidize her expenses.

loans.use: to buy articles for the home, jewelry, and school supplies.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC  AYLLU”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladis; la socia tiene 43 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 3 hijos de 22, 18, 14; La socia se dedica  a la elaboración de panes, la socia tiene una panadería y ella elabora todo tipo de panes y pasteles, la socia aprendió este negocio desde muy niña y el negocio era de sus padres y ella se puso a cargo, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de harinas y otros insumos como manteca, levaduras y esencias. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertiré n la compra de insumos para la panadería.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Gladis, 43, is a member of the “Sumac Ayllu” communal bank located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.  

She has a spouse and three children who are 22, 18 and 14 years of age.  She is a baker.  She has a bakery where she makes all sorts of bread and cakes.  She learned this occupation while still a little girl.  The business belonged to her parents and she took over.  She wants the loan to buy flour and other supplies like shortening, yeast and flavorings.  She requests the loan to buy supplies for the bakery.

She is grateful for the support that will be granted her and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her bakery.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emilio tiene 39 años, casado con Nelia de 37 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos. Juntos viven en su propia casa ubicada en la selva tropical de pichari. Emilio es hombre ambicioso, siendo su mayor motivo sus 4 hijos, es así que trabaja repartiendo pescado y pollo a las comunidades lejanas. Su herramienta de trabajo es una moto con el que se desplaza de pueblo en pueblo. Él se levanta a las 4 de la mañana y con el mismo entusiasmo y ganas emprende este negocio, vendiendo su mercadería alimenticia. En un futuro  desea contar con una movilidad frigorífica para poder llevarles los productos en mayor cantidad y mejores condiciones, de esta manera contar con un ingreso mucho más elevado del que ahora tiene. Este es su primer crédito por el que Emilio se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Por tanto espera la colaboración de ustedes para que pueda acceder a estos créditos. Con los 1.500 Emilio comprará más productos para vender variedad y calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Emilio, 39, is married to Nelia, 37, with whom he has four children.  They live together in their own house located in the tropical Pichari jungle.  Emilio is an ambitious man; his greatest motivation is his children.  He works selling fish and chicken in faraway communities.  His work tool is a motorcycle that he uses to get from town to town.

He gets up at 4am and with the same enthusiasm and desire carries out his business selling food supplies.  In the future, he’d like to have a refrigerated truck to transport his products in larger quantities and in better conditions so that he can earn much more than he currently does.

This is his first loan and Emilio commits to being very punctual with his installment payments.  He also hopes that all of you will collaborate with him so that he can access these loans.  Emilio will use the 1500 to buy more products to sell more variety and quality to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix the roof of her workshop.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC  AYLLU”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fanny; la socia tiene 38 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 3 hijos de 17, 15, 10 años de edad; La socia se dedica  al comercio minorista, la socia tiene un stand en el mercado y ella compra y vende papa helada, también la socia cría animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, chanchos, los cría en casa y una vez que estos se reproducen y que están actos para la venta ella los ofrece al por mayor a sus diferentes clientes dueños de restaurantes y quintas criollas; La socia desea el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de animales menores como gallinas y cuyes al por mayor.

 La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Fanny, 38, is a member of the “Sumac Ayllu” communal bank located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.

She has a spouse and three children who are 17, 15 and 10 years of age.  She is a retailer.  She has a stand in the market.  She’s a frozen potato merchant.  She also raises small farm animals like chickens, guinea pigs and pigs at home and when they reproduce and they are ready for sale she sells them at wholesale to various restaurant owners and Creole country houses.  She wants the loan to buy small farm animals, like chickens and guinea pigs, at wholesale.

She is grateful for the support she’ll get and at the same time commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy small farm animals, like chickens and guinea pigs, at wholesale.

loans.name: Yadira De La Concepcion

texts.es: Yadira de 32 años vive en el Municipio de puerto Morazán con su esposo y sus hijos y se dedica a la venta de mariscos. Su negocio funciona desde hace 13 años, cuando por sugerencia de su esposo que es pescador. Empezó este negocio con recursos propios, aunque al inicio no le fue muy fácil. Este financiamiento que recibe comprará camarones, pescados, conchas, chuletas y punches. Su meta más adelante es lograr adecuar su vivienda, un local como taller y punto comercial para diversificar su oferta y posicionarse en el mercado.
texts.en: Yadira, 32, lives in the municipality of port Morazán, with her husband and children.  She sells shellfish for a living.  She started her business 13 years ago when her husband, a fisherman, suggested she do so.  She began the business using her own savings and at first it was difficult.  This loan will help her buy shrimp, fish, conch, chops, and punch.  In the future, she would like to fix up her home, have shop so she can sell a greater variety of products, and get ahead in the market.

loans.use: To purchase shrimp, fish, shellfish, chops, and punches.

loans.name: Reyna Esmeralda

texts.es: Reyna Esmeralda tiene 53 años de edad y reside en el Municipio de Patuca, Olancho. Desde muy temprana edad comenzo a vender queso en los alrededores de la comunidad y poco a poco con el apoyo de los prestamos de FAMA a ido diversificando su negocio y ahora tambien cuenta con una pollera que tiene instalada en el patio de su casa. Ella sola atiende sus negocios y lo hace desde muy temprano por la mañana. Doña Reyna solicita el prestamo para comprar mas libras de queso y comprar materiales para construir una galera para los pollitos. Con el apoyo del prestamo espera que sus ventas aumenten para que pueda cubrir sus necesidades y las de su familia. Por los momentos el problema que enfrenta es que no tiene una galera para la cria de los pollitos. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y que este le permita humildemente seguir sosteniendo a su familia. Reyna ha sido clienta de FAMA por seis años y siempre ha pagado puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Reyna Esmeralda is 53 years old and lives in the municipality of Patuca, Olancho.  She started selling cheese from a very early age in adjacent communities and gradually, with help from FAMA loans, she’s been diversifying her business.  Now, she also raises chickens in her yard.  She tends to her businesses alone and starts very early in the morning.

Reyna is asking for the loan to buy more pounds of cheese and materials to build chicken coops for more chicks  With support from the loan she hopes that her sales will increase so that she can cover her and her family’s needs.

For the moment, the challenge she’s facing is that she does not have a chicken coop to raise her chicks in.  Her goal is to make her business grow so that she can continue to humbly support her family.  Reyna’s been a FAMA client for six years and she’s always made her installment payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC  AYLLU”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 29 años de edad, el socio es soltero, El socio se dedica a la construcción el socio desea invertir en la compra de maquinaria para su trabajo, el socio compraría también una mezcladora y motocierra con el crédito que le otorgaran, el socio desea trabaja con obras y presta sus servicios a las diferentes empresas que están en el rubro de la construcción. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maquinarias. 

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "SUMAC AYLLU" which is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.

He is 29, single, and in the construction business.  With the loan he is requesting, he wants to buy machinery for his work, as well as a mixer and motorsaw.  His wish is to work at construction sites and lend his services to different companies in the construction sector.  

He is grateful for the support and committed to paying the loan back on time.

loans.use: To buy machinery.

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es:
Felipa es integrante D. la  Alcancía Comunal “Gotitas D. Amor” que esta conformada por 7 personas dedicadas a diversas actividades D. comercio. 
Felipa tiene 63 años D. edad, es viuda con  7 hijos, D.  los cuales 2 dependen D. ella, la Sra. Felipa se dedica a la  venta D. productos como: kekes, panetónes, turrónes, entre otros, donD. lleva trabajando en ese rubro más D. 25 años, ella nos cuenta que empezó vendiendo comida y chupetes en las afueras D. su vivienda,  pero gracias al  buen uso que le dio a su dinero pudo juntar un capital e  invertir y emprender su propio  negocio.  Con su esfuerzo Felipa ha comprado su propio terreno y ayudado a sus  hijos en su educación. Felipa tiene como meta abrir una bodega donD. pueda ofrecer productos D. primera necesidad y así seguir apoyando en sus estudios a sus hijos. Con el préstamo solicitado  invertirá en sus productos comprando en mayor cantidad. La Alcancía Comunal “Gotitas D. Amor” son personas responsables que  agradecen el apoyo y la confianza depositada en ellos. La señora María no pudo estar presente porque tuvo que llevar a su esposo al médico.
texts.en:
Felipa, 63, is a member of the “Gotitas D. Amor” (Little Drops of Love) communal bank which has 7 members dedicated to diverse commercial activities.

She’s a widow with seven children two of which still depend on her.  She sells products like cakes, Panettones and nougats, among others.  She’s been in this line of work for over 25 years.  She tells us that she started out selling food and lollipops outsiD. her house.  Thanks to the good way she managed her income she was able to amass some capital to invest in starting her own business.  With her efforts, Felipa has purchased her own land and helped her children with their education.

Felipa’s goal is to open a store where she can sell basic need items to continue supporting her children’s schooling.  She will use the requested loan to buy larger amounts of products.

The “Gotitas D. Amor” communal bank’s members are responsible people who are grateful for the support and trust that’s been placed in them.
María wasn’t able to be present because she had to take her husband to the doctor.

loans.use: to buy cakes, nougats and Panettones.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC  AYLLU”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Benito tiene 56 años de edad, el socio es conviviente, El socio tiene 4 hijos los cuales son independientes; el socio es albañil de profesión, el socio desea invertir en la compra de herramientas y madera, el socio invertirá el crédito en la compra de taladro eléctrico y tabuladora. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de herramientas para la realización de su trabajo. 

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Sumac Ayllu". It is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Benito is 56 years old and he is married common-law. He has 4 grown children. He is a construction worker by profession. He wishes to invest in the purchase of tools and lumber. He will invest the loan in the purchase of an electric drill and a tabulator. He requests a loan to invest in the purchase of tools to carry out his work. 

He is thankful for the support that is granted to hinm and he is committed to making his loan payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase work tools.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas De San Antonio Group

texts.es: Blanca D. 32 años D. edad,es socia D. la Alcancia Comunal "Las Estrellitas D. San Antonio", es casada tiene 1 hija, La Socia aperturo un stand alquilado D. ventas D. útiles escritorios. El prestamo solicitado es para compras y ventas D. utiles D. escritorio como crepes, colores, crayolas, corrospun, lapiceros, borradores, etc. sus objetivos en el futuro es comprar su propio stand, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos familiare. La socia agradecen por la oportunidad   brindada para el capital D. trabajo D. sus negocios. ella esta en la primera fila lado derecha com chompa color rojo, pantalon color rojo.
texts.en: Blanca is 32 years old and is a member of the communal bank called "The Little Stars of San Antonio". She is married with one daughter. She has a rented stand where she sells writing supplies. The solicited loan is for the purchase and sale of writing supplies, such as crepe paper, crayons, pencils, ribbon, erasers, etc. Her objective for the future is to purchase her own stand. Her husband helps with the family expenses. She is grateful for the opportunity offered to her for working capital for her business. She is shown in the first row on the right siD. with the red colored sweater and red pants.

loans.use: to purchase ribbon, crepe paper, crayons, and pencils for her supply store.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC  AYLLU”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Emilio tiene 49 años de edad, el socio es conviviente, El socio tiene 2 hijos de 12, 10 años de edad; el socio se dedica a la construcción en construcción ven todo lo referente a la fabricación de casas y edificios; ellos elaboran la base de cemento y otros materiales para la construcción de casas, ven los materiales a poner y la resistencia de los mismos; el socio trabaja en diversas obras, el socio en esta ocasión requiere el crédito para poder apoyar a su conyugue con la compra de verduras al por mayor, ya que la pareja del socio tiene un stand en el mercado y vende verduras como zanahoria, cebolla, pepinos, lechugas, tomate, habas, arvejas; la pareja del socio comprara al por mayor verduras y pagara a sus proveedores. El socio solicita el préstamo para apoyar a su conyugue a implementar su stand en el mercado de ventas de verduras que ella comprara.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Sumac Ayllu” community bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district in the Cusco province and the Cusco department.

The member, Emilio, is 49 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He has two children aged 10 and 12 years old. He makes his living working in construction and a variety of projects. On this occasion the member needs a loan to be able to support his spouse with the purchase of wholesale vegetables as his spouse has a stand in the market and sells vegetables such as carrots, onions, peppers, lettuce, tomato, peas, etc. She will by wholesale vegetable and will pay the suppliers. The member is requesting a loan to be able to support his spouse in implementing her stand in the vegetable market.

The member appreciates the support you will give him and he is committed to paying his loan back in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of vegetables for his wife's stand

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo tiene 30 años, convive con su esposa, con quien tiene 1 hija de 7 años llamada Jessica. Juntos viven en su casa propia  ubicada en la comunidad de puerto mayo, del distrito de Pichari. Alfredo, es una persona que se caracteriza por tener muchos proyectos, pero asegura que debe realizarlo con mucha cautela para llegar a cumplir su meta, es por ello que empezó a cultivar cacao. A medida que sus ventas se incrementaron, decidió producir cacao. Sin embargo sabe que le falta mucho por recorrer, es por ello que se sacrifica desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer, con la finalidad de sacar provecho a sus tierras que todavía aún no cuentan con plantación alguna. Generalmente recibe la ayuda de su familia, para que así lo faciliten en la extracción de sus productos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Por ello espera la colaboración de todos ustedes para continuar con su producción de cacao. Con los 1.500 soles, desea comprar más plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 30 years old.  He lives with his wife and has one daughter, Jessica, who is 7 years old.  The family live in their own home which is located in Puerto Mayo community, in Pichari district.

Alfredo is noted for the fact that he has many plans in life.  However, he assures us that he must carry out his plans with a lot of caution if he is to reach his goals.  For this reason, he started to grow cacao.  As his sales increased, he decided to work on producing cacao.  However, he knows that he still has a long way to go.  He makes a lot of sacrifices from very early in the morning until very late at night.  His goal is to get a lot out of his land which is still not planted with crops.

Alfredo generally receives help from his family who give him a hand in harvesting his produce.  This is his second loan with MFP and he pledges to make his repayments on time.  He hopes to receive your cooperation so that he can continue producing cacao.  Alfredo will use the 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy more cacao plants.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants

loans.name: Antero German

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC  AYLLU”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Antero tiene 39 años de edad, el socio es conviviente, El socio tiene 3 hijos de 14, 4 y 3 meses de edad; El socio es comerciante minorista, el socio tiene una tienda de venta de todo tipo de licores y una tienda en general para lo cual el socio desea implementar y comprar en especial cajas de licores de fresa, mango, durazno, y vinos, whisky. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de licores para implementar su negocio.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Antero is a member of the "Sumac Ayllu" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Antero is 39 years old and lives with his partner.  He has three children aged 14, 4 and 3 months.  He is a salesman and has a store selling all kinds of liquor.  He also has a general store.  Antero would like to stock his business.  In particular he would like to buy cases of strawberry, mango and peach liquor; wine and whisky.  He is requesting this loan to buy liquor to stock his business.

Antero is grateful for the support that he is being given and pledges to make his repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying liquor to stock his business

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 45 años de edad. Actualmente, Maritza vive en la misma hermosa ciudad donde nació Cusco (Perú) junto con su hijo.  Maritza es docente de profesión y trabaja en la venta de materiales de construcción como por ejemplo cemento, hormigón, ladrillos y arena. Ya son varios que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Maritza requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo cemento y otras cosas más. La socia en el banco comunal es la tesorera y desempeña bien su cargo. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Juntas y Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Maritza is 45 years old and was born in the city of Cusco (Peru).  She currently lives in the beautiful city in which she was born (Cusco), together with her son.  Maritza is a teacher by profession and she also works selling building supplies such as cement, concrete, bricks and sand.  She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Maritza is requesting a loan to buy materials such as cement, etc.  Maritza is the treasurer of her community bank and she does well in her role.

Maritza is a responsible and hard-working person.  Owing to these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's 'Juntas y Unidas' community bank.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, etc.

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
L. Alcancía Comunal “Arco Iris” está conformada por 11 comuneros responsables, quienes se dedican a L. agricultura y ganadería en las zonas altas D. Huarochirí donD. para llegar a su comunidad se debe viajar en solo dos fechas a L. semana.
Hermenegildo  es un hombre  trabajador que junto a su esposa se dedican  hace  20 años a L. ganadería a L. fecha ya esta  contando con más D. 50 vacas producto D. ellas prepara y venD. queso, pero también se dedica a L. agricultura:  siembra y cosecha  papas, habas y maíz. Hermenegildo a sus 52 años ha logrado comprar su propio terreno y  sacar adelante a su familia. El sueño D. Hermenegildo es  seguir apoyando a su hijo en sus  estudios superiores D. contabilidad por que ya está por culminar su carrera, además desea seguir  trabajando  y obtener ganancias para brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Con el préstamo solicitado piensa comprarse una vaca que le fue ofrecida aun precio económico y a si asegurar su producción D. quesos. Los podemos ver en L. foto todos reunidos en nuestras instalaciones EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad, luego D. L. reunión D. desembolso  D. su capital D. trabajo.  Jesús y Gilberto no pudieron estar presentes en el desembolso por motivo D.  transporte.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Arco Iris” (rainbow) is maD. up of 11 responsible members who work in farming and cattle raising in the high zones of Huarochiri where to  travel to their village, they can only go twice a week.

Hermenegildo is a hard-working man who for the past 20 years has worked with his wife in cattle-raising and currently has more than 50 cows.  They use the milk to make and sell cheese, but also they are farmers.  The plant and harvest potatoes, lima beans and corn.  Hermenegildo is 52 and has been able to buy his own land and to get his family ahead.  His dream is to continue supporting his son in his accounting studies because he is almost finished with his degree.  He also wants to keep on working and to obtain income to improve his family’s standard of living.  He will use the loan to buy a cow that was offered to him at a good price and that will insure his cheese production.  
We can see them all together in the photo in the ESAPROSPO -Prosperidad (prosperity) office after the meeting when the working capital is distributed.   Jesús and Gilberto couldn’t be at the distribution because of transportation problems.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Marleni Vanessa

texts.es:
Marleni nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 39 años de edad. Actualmente, Marleni vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con sus dos hijos. Marleni se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo pollos. Ya son varios que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Marleni requiere el préstamo para comprar  más pollos. El sueño de Marleni abrir una tienda de venta de flores. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Juntas y Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Marleni is 39 years old and was born in the city of Cusco (Peru).  She currently lives in the same city in which she was born, together with her two children.  Marleni raises animals such as chickens.  She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  On this occasion, Marleni needs a loan to buy more chickens.  Her dream is to open a flower store.

Marleni is a responsible and hard-working person and, owing to these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's 'Juntas y Unidas' community bank.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: Segundo de 40 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Lenny de 23 años y sus 2 queridas hijas Andrea de 5 y Dayana de 2 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todas las mañanas Segundo se esmera mucho en trabajar sus tierras y dejarlas muy fértiles, ya que sabe que de eso depende la calidad de su piña, naranja y mandarina, los cuales posteriormente después de la cosecha llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene mucha libertad para trabajar en sus tierras, ya que puede disponer de su horario. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es hacer la limpieza de sus sembríos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Es el sexto crédito con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprar más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en: Segundo, 40, is a very unassuming and hardworking man who lives in his house with his wife Lenny, 23, and their 2 beloved daughters: Andrea, 5, and Dayana, 2.  They want to provide their daughters with a better quality of life.  Each morning, Segundo puts a lot of effort into working his fields, making them very fertile, since he knows that the quality of his pineapples, oranges and tangerines depends on this.  After the harvest, he will take the fruit to sell in the market in the city of Pucallpa.  What he likes most about his work is that he has a lot of freedom working in his fields, since he can set his own hours.  He has been farming for 20 years, and what he considers most difficult is clearing the fields.   In the future, he wants to buy new land so that he can increase his production.  This is his 6th loan with MFP, and he feels capable of making all of his payments.  He is one of the most active members of his communal bank, and because of this he is well liked and respected.  With the 1,000 Peruvian soles requested, he will buy more manure so that he can make his land more productive.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of manure

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 38 años de edad. Actualmente, Marilu vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con sus dos hijos. Marilu se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción  como por ejemplo cemento, ladrillos, arena, carrizos, hormigón y yeso. Ya son 7 años que se dedica este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Marilu requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como ladrillos y cemento. Marilu trabaja de lunes a sábados desde 7:30 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. El sueño de Marilu  abrir una tienda de ferretería. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Juntas y Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Marilu was born in the city of Cusco, Peru, and she is 38 years old.  Now Marilu lives in the same city where she was born, along with her two children.  Marilu has a business selling construction materials, such as: cement, bricks, sand, reeds, cement and plaster.  She has had this business for 7 years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  At this time Marilu needs a loan to buy materials such as bricks and cement.  Marilu works  Monday through Saturday from 7:30 in the morning until 8 at night.  Marilu's dream is to open her own hardware store.

Marilu is a responsible and hardworking person; because of these qualities her companions invited her to participate in the communal bank "Juntas y Unidas" in the  Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy materials such as bricks and cement

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris de 44 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rómulo de 55 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Doris es la compra y venta de pescado, su constante animo de superación ha hecho que incursione en este negocio y poco a poco se ha hecho muy conocida, ya que ella vende el pescado más fresco y sabroso del mercado y es una vendedora muy alegre que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que los más difícil es soportar el intenso olor que sale de los pescados, ya que este se le pega en la ropa. Espera tener en el futuro un pequeño frigorífico donde pueda vender pescado sin temor a que se malogren con el calor del sol. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido y espera poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, por la alegría que pone en el grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, hará arreglar su congeladora, ya que con el paso de los años se ha deteriorado, con el dinero que le quede comprará más pescado para tener más mercadería para vender.
texts.en:
Doris, 44, is a simple, hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband Rómulo, 55, and their four dear children, for whom they want to provide the best lifestyle possible.  Doris buys and sells fish for a living.  Her constant desire to get ahead is what encouraged her to get involved in this business, and little by little she has become well known.  She sells the freshest and tastiest fish at the market and is a cheerful saleslady who always receives her customers with a smile.  What she enjoys most about her work is talking to the customers.  She has been in business for 13 years and believes the hardest part is having to put up with the strong fish smell that gets into her clothing.  

In the future she hopes to have a small refrigerator so she can sell the fish without the fear of it going bad because of the heat.  This is her seventh loan through MFP and she is happy to have obtained it and committed to paying it back on time.  In her communal bank she is a much-loved member because of the joy she brings into the group.  With the 1,500 PEN she has requested she plans to fix her freezer which has deterioriated over the years.  With the rest of the money she will buy more fish to have more volume to sell.

loans.use: To fix her freezer and buy more fish.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 62 años D. edad. Actualmente, Maruja vive en la misma ciudad donD. nació junto con sus seis hijos.  Maruja tiene una pequeña oficina donD. se realiza fotocopias, e impresiones y otras cosas más.  Ella tiene empleados quienes se encargan D. la tienda, ellos trabajan realizados los servicios D. tipeos en computadora, fotocopias, etc. Ya son 9 años que se dedica este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Maruja requiere el préstamo para comprar insumnos como tinta, papel, CD y otras cosas más. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Juntas y Unidas” D. la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Maruja, 62,  was born in the city of Cusco (Perú) and lives in the same city with her six children.  She has a small office where she provides photocopy, printing and other services.  She has employees who manage the store and handle computer input and photocopy services, etc.

She has been in business for nine years and it is going well thanks to her hard work.  Maruja is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as ink, paper, CD's and other items.

She is a responsible, hard-working person for which her colleagues invited her to participate in the communal bank "Juntas y Unidas" which belongs to the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Mejia-Villatoro Group

texts.es: Lidia Maribel tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos entre las edades de 5 y 14 años, reside en las cercanias del Boulevard principal en Juticalpa y es miembro del Grupo Solidario Mejia-V.. Desde hace diez años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y zapatos de la marca Avon y Selsa. Realiza sus ventas por catalogo y lo hace por las tardes en visitas de casa en casa. Lidia es una persona afable y muy conocida por sus vecinos así que le va muy bien con las ventas y hasta a ganado varios premios. El préstamo que solicita lo necesita para surtir su negocio y así ofrecerle a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos. Con el apoyo del prestamo su negocio seguira activo y podrá seguir enviando a sus hijos
texts.en:
Lidia Maribel, 40, is married and has four children between the ages of 5 and 14.  She lives near the main boulevard in Juticalpa and is a member of the communal bank Grupo Solidario Mejía-V..  For ten years she has been selling Avon cosmetics and Selsa brand shoes by catalogue.  She visits her customers on a door-to-door basis.  Lidia is a nice person and very well known by her neighbors, so her sales volume is very good and she has won many awards.

She is requesting a loan to buy more inventory and offer her customers a wider variety of products.  With the loan she can stay in business and continue giving her children an education.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and shoes.

loans.name: Qoriwasi Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIWASI”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Miria; la socia tiene 48 años de edad, la socia es soltera; La socia tiene es docente de profesión y tambien ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual la administra junto a su madre, al socia desea invertir el prestamo que se le otorgara en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, la socia comprara arroz, azucar, fideos, harina, leche. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos para la implementaciónde su tieda de abarrotes.


Los otros socios se dedican  a la atencion  de su botica, docencia, cuidado de niños y ancianos, comercio minorista y tienda de abarrotes.

 La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir el pago de sus cuotas de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Miria is a member of the communal bank "QORIWASI", which is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and deparment of Cusco.

She is 48 years old and single.  She is a teacher by profession and also runs a grocery store with her mother.  She is requesting a loan to buy basic needs products such as rice, sugar, pasta, flour and milk to stock her store.

The other members are involved in store management, teaching, working as caregivers for children and the elderly, retailing and running grocery stores.

This member is grateful for the support and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To set up a grocery store.

loans.name: La Ñusta Iii Group

texts.es:
LA ÑUSTA III es un banco comunal que pertenece a la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la casa de una de las socias. En la reunión conocimos  a la socia Cerafina. 
    
Cerafina es integrante del banco comunal “LA ÑUSTA III” hace 1 año y recientemente por decisión de todo el grupo le otorgaron el puesto de presidenta, en la foto sale la presidenta sale sentada y está levantando la mano. Entre todo el grupo decidieron ponerle ese nombre a su banco comunal “LA ÑUSTA III” porque a todos les pareció bien y les gusto ese nombre este grupo lo conforman 12 personas las cuales tienen ya vaR. años trabajando con la Asociación.

Cerafina nació en el valle de Lares (Calca, Cusco) y tiene 52 años de edad es una madre de nueves hijos los cuales son dependientes e independiente. Cerafina trabaja en lo que es la venta de verduras en diferentes mercados de la zona como por ejemplo en la ciudades de Conchacalla, Choquecancha, Lares, Cachin, Calca y Sontococha. Cerafina piensa invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de maíz, papa y verduras. Ella no tiene un puesto de venta si no se instala de forma ambulatoria  en las ciudades antes mencionadas.
texts.en:
La Nusta III is a communal bank belonging to Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner) in the city of Calca (Cusco, Peru). The communal bank meetings are held every thirty days at a member's house. In a meeting we met Cerafina. 

Cerafina has been a member of the communal bank "La Nusta III" for the past year and recently, by decision of the entire group, she was granted the seat of president. In the photo she is seated and she has a raised hand. The entire group decided on the name of the communal bank "La Nusta III" because they all thought it was a good name. The group is made up of 12 members who have all been with Asociacion Arariwa for many years.

Cerafina was been in Valle de Lares (Calca, Cusco) and she is 52 years old. She is the mother of nine children, some are dependents and some are independent. Cerafina is involved in the sale of vegetables in different markets in the region, for example in the cities of Conchacalla, Choquecancha, Lares, Cachin, Calca, and Sontococha. Cerafina plans on investing the funds from her loan in the purchase of corn, potatoes, and vegetables. She does not have a sales stand, so instead she sells itinerantly in the cities mentioned.

loans.use: to purchase corn, potatoes, and vegetables.

loans.name: Ma. Marivit

texts.en:
Ma. Marivit is 36 years old and married with three children in school. Ma. Marivit works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Marivit runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Ma. Marivit has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo etc. 

In the future, Ma. Marivit would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es: Rosa Margarita de 31 años de edad, vive en su casa con sus dos pequeñas hijas Katherine y Karen las cuales tienen 6 y 3 añitos de edad respectivamente, ambas se encuentran cursando sus primeros años de estudio. Para Rosa sus hijas lo son todo y trabaja duramente para sacarlas adelantes y darles una vida diferente a la que Ella tuvo. Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en una pequeña tiendita que ha logrado establecer en su hogar de residencia. Es una mujer confiable y con mucha amabilidad que ha logrado ganarse la confianza de todo su vecindario, los cuales la prefieren,  ya que  siempre cuenta con lo que ellos necesitan y sobre todo reciben un buen trato. Últimamente ha pensado mucho en cómo hacer crecer su negocio y ha decidido abastecer su tienda con variedad de productos que sean atractivos para los clientes, pero para echar andar esta idea necesita este crédito que solicita a INTEGRAL para poder comprar los principales insumos como: bebidas, arroz, frijoles, aceite, golosinas, papel, pan dulce, café, tomates, cebollas, papas,  etc.  Que le permitan atraer más clientes y lograr cumplir su sueño de dar a sus hijas mejores oportunidades.
texts.en: Rosa Margarita is 31 years old and she lives at home with her two young daughters, Katherine and Karen. They are 6 and 3 years old respectively and they are in their first years of school. For Rosa, her daughters are everything to her and she works very hard to provide for them and to give them a life different from the one she lived. Rosa sells essential goods from a small store that she has managed to establish in her home. She is a trustworthy woman who is very kind and she has won the respect of her entire neighborhood. They prefer to buy from her especially because she always has what they need, and, above all, they receive good customer service. Lately she has been thinking of expanding her business and so she decided to supply her store with a variety of products that are attractive to her clients. But in order to set her plan in motion she needs a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner). She will purchase essential goods, such as: drinks, rice, beans, cooking oil, sweets, bathroom tissue, pastries, coffee, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, etc. This will help her attract more clients and she will accomplish her dream of provide her daughters with better opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase essential goods such as drinks, rice, beans, cooking oil, sweets, bathroom tissue, pastries, coffeee, tomatoes, onions, etc.

loans.name: María Eulalia

texts.es: María Eulalia D. 54 años D. edad, vive con su esposo David D. 61 años en su casa. Los hijos D. ambos residen en Estados Unidos  los cuales ayudan un poco en el sostenimiento del hogar. María posee una pequeña tienda en su hogar D. residencia en la cual venD. productos D. primera necesidad como bebidas, granos básicos,  golosinas, y D. más artículos que los clientes solicitan. Es una mujer emprendedora y creativa ya que a pesar D. que existen más tiendas cerca D. su negocio ha logrado ganarse la confianza D. muchos clientes y cada día la prefieren más gracias a su carisma. Es una mujer luchadora y le gusta trabajar por el pan D. cada día. Por lo que ha tomado la decisión D. incrementar su negocio y para esto necesita D. la ayuda D. un crédito el cual solicita a Integral para poder comprar variedad D. productos D. tienda como: bebidas, detergente, arroz, azúcar, pan dulce, frijoles, golosinas, aceite, etc. Con la fe puesta en Dios que logrará obtener resultados favorables y logrará mejorar su condición D. vida y la D. su querido esposo.
texts.en: Maria Eulalia is 54 years old and she lives at home with her husband David, who is 61 years old. Both of their children live in the United States and they help somewhat with the support of the household. Maria has a small store in her house and she sells essential goods such as drinks, basic grains, sweets, and other products that her clients request. She is an enterprising and creative woman. Despite the fact that there are other stores near her business she has managed to earn many clients and every day she sees more clients thanks to her charisma. She is a fighter and she likes to work to earn the daily bread. She has taken the decision to increase her business and for this she needs the help of a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner). She will purchase a variety of products for her store, such as: drinks, detergent, rice, sugar, pastries, beans, sweets, cooking oil, etc. With her faith set on God she will be able to obtain favorable results and she will improve her living conditions and those of her beloved husband.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products for her store, such as: drinks, detergent, rice, sugar, pastries, beans, sweets, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia D. 50 años D. edad, habita con su esposo e hijo en su casa. Su esposo Mario D. 44 años D. edad y su hijo D. 14 años, le ayudan en su negocio que desD. hace años ha sido su principal fuente D. ingresos. Ella se dedica a la venta D. desayunos D. manera ambulante en las principales áreas D. la zona donD. habita. DesD. tempranas horas D. la mañana se levanta a preparar  los ricos e higiénicos desayunos que día a día ofrece a sus clientes, gracias a su carisma y amabilidad en su trabajo ha logrado ganarse la confianza D. muchas personas y cada día el nivel D. clientes aumenta. Debido a esto ha decidido aumentar la oferta D. sus platillos con el objetivo D. cubrir una mayor demanda y lograr aumentar sus ganancias. Esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar la materia prima necesaria como: pollo, carne, verduras, frijoles, maíz, arroz, huevos, aceite, etc. Que le permitan aumentar el número D. platillos que ofrece así como atraer el número D. clientes necesarios que compren sus ricos desayunos. Con esto espera obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan brindar una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia.
texts.en: Lucia is 50 years old and she lives with her husband and son at home. Her husband Mario is 44 years old and their son is 14 years old. They help her with the business, which for years has been their primary source of income. She sells lunch foods itinerantly through the main streets of the region where she lives. She starts her day in the early morning to prepare her delicious and healthy lunch foods that she sells to her clients day after day. Thanks to her charisma and her kindness she has managed to earn many clients and each day they increase in number. She has decided to increase the variety in her menu with the objective of covering a greater demand and to increase her earnings. This has led her to take the decision of requesting a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner). She will purchase necessary ingredients, such as: chicken, meat, vegetables, beans, corn, rice, eggs, cooking oil, etc. This will help her increase production and it will attract the volume of clients she needs to purchase her lunch foods. Through this she expects to improve her income and it will help her proviD. a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as chicken, meat, vegetables, beans, corn, rice, eggs, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 39 years old.  She is married and has 4 children, 3 of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elvira has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 4 years.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall.  Elvira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gigi

texts.en:
Gigi is 43 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Gigi runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as biscuits, noodles, bread and other miscellaneous items.  She has been in this business for 2 years.   

Gigi has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store.   She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy more items to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is married and works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 30 years.  

Romana has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ma. Elma

texts.en:
Ma. Elma is 49 years old.  She is married and has 4 children. With all 4 children in school, Ma. Elma works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Elma runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines.  She sells a  variety of items such as shampoo, soap, sugar, snack food and other groceries.   She has been in this business for 2 years.  

Ma. Elma has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: buy items to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 47 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, 1 of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.   Judy has a food vending business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 6 years.  

Judy has requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.  In the future, she would like to save more money.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married and a mother of four school-age children. She is 32 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Marites is a farmer. She plants rice and harvests palay to earn a living. She sells palay and rice grains in local community. She has been doing this for 14 years. She earns approximately PHP 21,000 quarterly from her farm. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000.00 to pay the labor costs for rice planting and to purchase fertilizers.

Marites has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Marites hopes to gain more profit and purchase a rice field.

loans.use: To pay the labor cost to plant rice and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells natural medicines in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock for her natural medicines business.

Sylvia has been in this business for seven years. Sylvia earns more income from selling magazines and from her carinderia (restaurant).

Sylvia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emma Luz

texts.es: Emma Luz D. 50 años D. edad, vive en su casa con sus dos hijos y su querido esposo D. 50 años D. edad. Sus dos hijos se encuentran estudiando y esta es la razón por la cual Emma se esfuerza día a día por sacarlos adelante. Emma se dedica a la venta D. embutidos, carnes y verdura fresca. Hace mucho tiempo que se dedica al negocio y gracias a Dios y a su dedicación ha logrado mantenerlo activo durante mucho tiempo. Su sueño es seguir  contando con su pequeño negocio que durante todo este tiempo les ha ayudado a sobrevivir y espera que lo siga siendo ya que desea darles a sus hijos el estudio para que algún día puedan salir D. la situación en la que se encuentran. Ella sabe que la única forma D. hacerlo es trabajando, es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en  variedad D. productos que le permitan a traer a mas clientes. Con el crédito espera comprar carnes, variedad D. embutidos y variedad D. verduras frescas como: zanahorias, papas, tomates, cebollas, etc. Espera que los resultados sean favorables y D. esta manera poder seguir ayudando a su querida familia.
texts.en: Emma Luz is 50 years old and she lives at home with her two children and her beloved 50-year old husband. Her two children are in school and they are the reason why Emma struggles day after day to proviD. for them. Emma sells sausages, meats, and fresh vegetables. She has been in business for a long time and thanks to God and to her dedication she has managed to keep it active for so long. Her dream is to keep on depending on her small business. Throughout all this time it has helped them survive. She hopes to proviD. her children with an education so that one day they will be able to leave the situation in which they find themselves. She knows that the only way to achieve this is to keep working. For this reason she has decided to request a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner). She will invest in a variety of products that will attract more clients. With the loan she plans on purchasing meats, a variety of sausages and a variety of fresh vegetables such as: carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, onions, etc. She hopes that the results will be favorable so that she will be able to continue supporting her beloved family.

loans.use: to purchase meats, a variety of sausages, and a variety of vegetables, such as carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús de 31 años de edad, reside en su casa con su esposo e hija de 4 años de edad. Teresa es una mujer emprendedora que ha convertido su casa en un negocio. Hace tres años que posee una tiendita en la cual vende variedad de productos como: arroz, aceite, pan dulce, detergente, champo, azúcar, leche, café, etc. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en una zona muy accesible y concurrida. Gracias a la buena ubicación del negocio y a la habilidad de buena vendedora que posee a Teresa los clientes la  prefieren. Además se caracteriza por mantener lo que el cliente necesita y sobre todo con los mejores precios. Ha pensado en aumentar su inventario para seguir dando a sus clientes el mejor servicio y poder mantenerlos satisfechos para que siempre demanden sus productos. Debido a que no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para poder invertir en su negocio ha decidido solicitar este crédito con la fe puesta en Dios que de esta manera su calidad de vida y la de su familia cambiará. El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de artículos de tienda como: detergentes, granos básicos (arroz, azúcar, frijoles), golosinas, pan dulce, y de más artículos que permitan a traer a más clientes demandantes de sus productos.
texts.en: Teresa de Jesus is 31 years old and she lives at home with her husband and their 4-year old daughter. Teresa is an enterprising woman that has converted her home into a business. Three years ago she has a small store from where she sells a variety of products, such as: rice, cooking oil, pastries, detergents, shampoo, sugar, milk, coffee, etc. Her business is located in a region that is very accessible and well traveled. Thanks to the good location of the business and her good knowledge of sales, clients prefer to buy from Teresa. She is also known to keep in store what the clients need and at better prices. She has thought about increasing her inventory to keep providing her clients with a better level of service and to keep them satisfied so that they will continue to demand her products. Given that she does not have the resources she needs to invest in her business she decided to request a loan. Her faith is set on God to improve the quality of her life and that of her family. She will use her loan to purchase store products, such as: detergents, basic grains (rice, sugar, and beans), sweets, pastries, and other products that will help her attract more clients.

loans.use: to purchase store products such as detergents, basic grains (rice, sugar, beans) sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Jeward

texts.en:
Jeward is 19 years old, single and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Jeward started a business at a very young age. He owns and operates a retail store to earn a living. He sells basic food items and refreshments. Jeward helps his parents to generate extra income. He earns PHP 4,100 per month in this activity. He has been engaged in this type of business for over four years. Jeward has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to purchase rice and corn to sell. 

Jeward has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Jeward hopes to have a grocery store in the town.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn to sell.

loans.name: Nery Esterly

texts.es: Nery Esterly de 30 años de edad, reside en casa familiar con sus padres y su pequeña hija de un año de edad. Nery se dedica a la venta de leña. Hace mucho tiempo que su familia posee este negocio y ahora Ella ha tomado el negocio y quiere hacerlo crecer para lograr obtener un poco mas de ingresos que ayuden a su familia a salir adelante. Posee buena clientela ya que ella y su familia son muy reconocidas en la zona y le tienen mucha confianza. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  con el objetivo de invertir en su negocio y hacerlo crecer. Con el crédito piensa comprar más leña para poder tener disponible siempre que los clientes soliciten. Y de esta manera espera mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Nery Esterly is 30 years old and she lives in the family home with her parents and her little 1-year old daughter. Nery sells firewood. Her family has had this business for a long time and now she has taken over the business. She wants to make it grow in order to increase a little more her income, to help her family move forward. She has a good client base because she and her family are very well known in the region and they are well trusted. She has made the decision to request a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) with the goal of investing in her business and expanding it. With the loan she plans on purchasing more firewood to have it in stock whenever her clients request it. This way she hopes to improve the quality of her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase firewood..

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 62 years old and a widow with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Juanita has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Juanita has been in this business for five years. Juanita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of products such as eggs, cooking oil, rice, sugar, milk, coffee, sweets, drinks, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is married and a mother of two school-age dependents. She is 35 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Amalia is a farmer. She grows pineapples to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Twice a year she earns PHP 48,000 in this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay labor cost for soil plowing and to purchase fertilizers. Amalia has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Amalia hopes to gain more profit and expand her pineapple farming.

loans.use: To pay the labor cost for plowing and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Juliebeth

texts.en:
Juliebeth is 41 years old and married with two children.

Juliebeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a dried fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Juliebeth has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the dried fish vending for eight years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Juliebeth aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa D. Jesús D. 41 años D. edad, habita en casa propia con su esposo y tres hijos D. 22, 16 y 7 años. Teresa sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales y por ellos lucha con todo su amor para sacarlos adelante y darles lo que necesitan. Ella se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad como: granos básicos, bebidas, detergentes, golosinas, huevos, etc. Negocio que posee en su hogar D. residencia el cual es muy concurrido, debido a que Teresa es muy conocida en la zona y se ha sabido ganar la confianza D. sus vecinos. Solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para surtir su tiendita y poder ofrecer variedad y mejores productos a sus clientes. Ella espera poder contar con este crédito para comprar variedad D. insumos como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, leche, café, galletas, pan dulce, huevos, aceite y todo tipo D. producto atractivo para los clientes. D. esta manera aspira mejorar su condición D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en: Teresa D. Jesus is 41 years old and she lives in a house of her own together with her husband and three children, aged 22, 16, and 7. Teresa dreams to see her children in great careers and for them she struggles with all of her love to move them forward and to give them what they need. She sells essential goods such as: basic grains, drinks, detergents, sweets, eggs, etc. Her business is installed in her house and it is highly frequented given that Teresa is very well known in the region. She has earned the trust of her neighbors. She request a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) to supply her store and to offer variety and better products to her clients. She hopes of having this loan to purchase a variety of products, such as: beans, rice, sugar, milk, coffee, cookies, pastries, eggs, cooking oil, and all types of products that are attractive to clients. She aspires to improve the condition of her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products such as beans, rice, sugar, milk, coffee, cookies, pastries, eggs, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Dioza

texts.en:
Dioza is married and a mother of three school-age children. She is 31 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Dioza is a farmer and grows pineapples to earn a living. She sells pineapples in the local community either by volume or at retail. She has been doing this for three years. Every six months, she earns PHP 40,000 from this farming. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase plastic mulch and fertilizers.

Dioza has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Dioza hopes to expand her production and to be a good member of the cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase plastic mulch and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jumdah

texts.en:
Jumdah is 35 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  Jumdah runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  She also earns an income from farming coconut.  She works hard to provide for her family.

Jumdah has requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as shampoo, sardines, noodles, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  She has borrowed and repaid 5 previous loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Jumdah aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy more items to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is married and has a vegetable and spices vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 7 years now, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  She works hard to support her family.  

Letecia has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a good living condition for her family.

loans.use: buy vegetables and spices

loans.name: Aníbal

texts.es: Aníbal de 29 años de edad, reside en casa familiar con sus padres, esposa y dos hijas de 7 y 1 año de edad. Aníbal es un hombre emprendedor y luchador. Hace algunos años se decidió en poner un pequeño negocio en el lugar de residencia de la zona donde  él habita. El negocio consiste en una pequeña tienda que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo de varios años. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que para Aníbal  lo más importante son los clientes, siempre los atiende con una sonrisa y mucha amabilidad razón por la cual se ha ganado la confianza de muchos en la zona y además porque siempre tiene lo que los clientes buscan. Él sueña con dar a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida y sabe que la única fuente de ingresos es su pequeño negocio, por tanto no puede descuidarse de  el y lucha por mantenerlo activo. Es por esta razón que se motivo en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRLAL para poder invertir en su tiendita y abastecerla con todo tipo de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, papel, detergente, y de más productos que permitan atraer a más clientes. Sin perder la fe que algún día logrará salir de la situación en la que se encuentra y mejoraran sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Anibal is 29 years old and he lives at home with his parents, his wife and their two daughters, aged 7 and 1. Anibal is an enterprising man and a fighter. Some years ago he decided to set up a small business in his house, in the region where he lives. The business consists of a small store that, with great effort and dedication. he has maintained through the passing of the years. He enjoys a large clients base and for Anibal the clients are what matters most. He always attends them with a smile and with great kindness, and for this reason he has earned the trust of many in the region. Additionally he always has what the clients are looking for. He dreams of providing his daughters with a better quality of life and his only source of income is his small business. He cannot distract himself from it and he struggles to keep it active. This is the reason why he was motivated to request a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner). He will invest in his store and he will supply it with all types of products, such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, sweets, cooking oil, bathroom tissue, detergents, and other products that will help him attract more clients. His faith will not waiver that some day he will leave his situation and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, sweets, cooking oil, bathroom tissue, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married with two school-age children. She is 29 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Emma is a farmer. She plants and harvests pineapples to earn a living. She sells pineapples in the local open market. She has been doing this for two years. Twice a year, she earns approximately PHP 48,000 doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase crown, a planting material for pineapples.

Emma has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Emma hopes to purchase a hectare of land to be used in pineapple production.

loans.use: To purchase planting material for pineapples.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various ingredients such as chicken, rice, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married and a mother of one infant-age child. She is 24 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Irene is a farmer. She grows pineapples to earn a living. She sells pineapples in neighboring places. She has been doing this for two years. She earns PHP 40,000 twice a year in this type of business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to pay labor costs for harvesting and transportation.

Irene has been member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Irene hopes to expand her business and purchase a hectare of land for pineapple farming.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for harvesting and transportation.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is married and a mother of two school-age children. She is 34 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Ritchel is a farmer. She grows and harvests pineapples to earn a living. She sells pineapples in a local open market and sometimes she sells by bulk to the local traders. She has been in this business for two years. She earns PHP 35,000 twice a year in this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer and fruit baskets.

Ritchel has been a member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, Ritchel hopes to purchase plowing equipment together with a buffalo to be used in her pineapple production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and fruit baskets.

loans.name: Rosa Milagro

texts.es: Rosa Milagro de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida. Ella posee una pupuseria con la que mantiene a flote su hogar; vive en un lugar muy concurrido de personas y su pupuseria es muy conocida en la zona pues las pupusas que prepara tienen un sabor inigualable y las vende a precios accesibles además les da el mejor de los servicios es muy amable y siempre tiene lo que necesita el cliente. Para Rosa Milagro la posibilidad de realizar un sueño es lo que hace la vida interesante, quiere ver crecer su negocio y está haciendo lo posible para cumplirlo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar insumos para la preparación de las pupusas como chicharrón, queso, frijoles, maíz y bebidas. De esta forma siempre mantendrá la necesidad de la clientela y cumplirá su meta. Rosa tiene la confianza que su trabajo y esfuerzo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa Milagro is fifty four years old and she lives with her life's companion. She has a pupuseria with which she supports her family. She lives somewhere with a lot of people and her pupuseria is very well known because the pupusas she makes are unsurpassed and she sells them at accessible prices. She also gives the best service and is very friendly and she always has what her customer needs. For Rosa Milagro, the possibility of making a dream come true is what makes life interesting. She wants to see her business grow and she is doing what she can to make this possible. That is why she is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL to buy ingredients to prepare the pupusas such as pork cracklings, cheese, beans, corn and beverages. In this way, she will have what her customers need, and reach her goal. Rosa is confident that her work and dedication will allow her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: pork cracklings, cheese, beans, corn and beverages.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married and a mother of two school-age children. She is 33 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Marites is a farmer. She grows and harvests pineapples to earn a living. She sells pineapples by bulk and at retail. She has been doing this for two years. She earns PHP 40,000 twice a year in this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to pay the labor costs for soil harrowing (cultivation) and to purchase fertilizers.

Marites has been a member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, Marites hopes to purchase a hectare of land and continue her production to gain more income.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for harrowing (cultivating) the soil and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Paz

texts.es: Paz, D. cincuenta y cinco años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en casa propia. ElL. fabrica ropa D. cama y L. venD. en diferentes lugares, se ha hecho D. mucha clienteL. ya que su producto es D. muy buena calidad posee diferentes diseños y a buen precio; Paz siempre esta adelante D. L. competencia busca siempre lo novedoso y cumplir sus metas, es una mujer emprendedora y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material para sus productos como teL., hilos, agujas, algodón, bolsas D. empaque entre otros. D. esta manera Paz podrá seguir produciendo y no decepcionara a sus clientes, además tiene L. esperanza que con su trabajo podrá llevar seguridad económica al hogar y una mejor calidad D. vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Paz, aged fifty-five, lives with her life partner and children in their own home.  She makes bed linens and sells them in different places.  She has many customers because her products are of good quality, have different designs, and are cheap.  Paz is always ahead of the competition as she seeks to keep things new, and she always meets her goals.  

She is an enterprising woman who is eager to get ahead, which is why she decided to ask for a loan through INTEGRAL.  This will allow her to purchase materials for her products such as fabric, thread, needles, cotton, bags for packaging and other things.  In this way Paz can continue with her production and not disappoint her customers.  She also hopes that her work may bring economic security to her home and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, cotton.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is married and a mother of four school-age children. She is 37 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Flora is a farmer. She plants and harvests pineapple to earn a living. She sells pineapples by bulk to the local traders. She has been doing this for two years. Twice a year, she earns PHP 40,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase herbicides and fertilizers.

Flora has been a member of GDMPC for two months. In the future, Flora hopes to earn more income and continue her pineapple production.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
30 year-old Dy is a cattle seller. His wife is a farmer. Both can earn $190 per month. They have 2 children, one of whom is studying and one is too small to go to school. Every month, he has to spend $75 on food and $6 on other expenses for the family. He would like a loan of $1000 to buy cattle to sell. Previously, he was also a farmer with his wife, but the income is not good and can’t support the family.  He has to pay for his children's schooling. 

He saw others have success selling cattle and so he decided to do the same. Now he can earn a better income.  He plans to buy more cattle to sell in the city when he has enough money.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is married and a mother of three school-age children. She is 37 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Edna is a farmer. She grows and harvests pineapples to earn a living. She sells fresh pineapple at the roadside to travelers and motorists. She has been doing this for two years. Twice a year, she earns a total average of PHP 50,000 in this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to pay labor cost for land clearing.

Edna has been a member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, Edna hopes to purchase land for pineapple production and gain more profit.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for clearing her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Teofila works hard to support her family.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Teofila is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to customers.

Teofila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Crystal

texts.en:
Crystal founded Detroit Brunch in November 2010 after noticing a growing demand amongst friends for quality vegan foods during her Sunday brunches. An entrepreneur at heart, Crystal saw an opportunity to start her business in order to create a vegan space for community members, embody sustainable business practices, and educate members of the Detroit community about the food system and benefits of healthy and locally grown foods. 

Today, Detroit Brunch organizes a brunch one Sunday per month with food from local farmers purchased at Detroit’s Eastern Market, while Crystal continues to work at a Deli.  Individuals place brunch orders online and pick up the food from a public spot in downtown Detroit.  Crystal is energized by the support of her local community, with volunteers stepping forward to assist with development of marketing materials and other areas of her business. 

Crystal hopes one day to expand Detroit Brunch through either a food truck or commercial kitchen in Detroit.  With this loan from ACCION USA, Crystal will participate in a Fast-Trac business planning and one-on-one counseling program with Detroit’s Tech Town, fulfilling her desire to enhance community connections and refine her market strategy. 

This loan has been made as a part of Kiva Detroit and in partnership with Michigan Corps and ACCION USA.  Kiva Detroit is the first Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations and field partners in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. Michigan Corps is the first community organization to work with Kiva in Detroit, and conducts outreach through small business networks, churches, community foundations, and across many personal and social media networks. Learn more at kiva.org/detroit.

loans.use: to participate in a business development and networking course.

loans.name: Annette

texts.en:
Annette is married and a mother of three adult-age children. She is 51 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Annette is a farmer. She grows and harvests pineapples to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Twice a year, Annette earns approximately PHP 50,000 from this farming business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase plastic mulch to prevent weeds from growing.

Annette has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Annette hopes to expand her pineapple farming and finish the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase plastic mulch.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann, 34 years old, is a motor taxi driver. His wife is a seller in Chhuck Market.  Their income is $7.50 per day. They have 3 children. Every month, he has to spend $50 on food, $7 on electricity, $40 on school fees and $5 on other expenses.
