He would like a loan of $1000 to buy a new motorbike because the current motorbike is too old and broken most of the time. He expects to earn more income to support all of his children in school.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for his work

loans.name: David Armando

texts.es: David Armando de treinta y dos años de edad reside solo en su casa; un joven optimista que siempre lucha por un mejor futuro. El posee un gimnasio el cual es muy visitado por las personas del lugar se ha hecho de mucha fama pues tiene el mejor equipo, en un lugar accesible a precios realmente bajos. David piensa que el ejercicio es la mejor forma de mantenerse activo en la vida y motiva a su clientela para que trabajen duro empezando por su buena  salud; el esta entusiasmado con su trabajo y quiere que el negocio crezca es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más maquinaria como pesas, cintas andadoras, bicicletas estáticas, de esta forma podrá cumplir una de sus grandes metas. David tiene fe que esto le permitirá tener en su hogar la estabilidad económica que necesita.
texts.en: David Armando is 32 years old and lives alone.  He is an optimistic young man that always strives for a better future.  He owns a gym that is frequented often by the people that live here.  He has a good reputation because he has the best equipment, an accessible location and very low prices.  David believes that exercise is the best way to stay active and encourages his customers to work hard, beginning with good health.  He is enthusiastic about his work and wants his business to grow.  It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow him to buy more equipment such as weights, treadmills and stationary bikes and thereby, fulfill one of his greatest goals.  David has faith that this will allow him to have the financial stability that he needs in his household.

loans.use: purchase weights, treadmills and stationary bicycles.

loans.name: Sisinia

texts.en: Sisinia is married and a mother of three school-age children. She is 49 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Sisinia is a farmer. She grows pineapple and sells to the local community to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She harvests twice a year and earns PHP 50,000 from this farming. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer for her pineapples. Sisinia has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Sisinia hopes to gain more profit and purchase land for pineapple production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is married with two adult-age children. She is 54 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Nida is a farmer and grows pineapples to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years with a half-year income of PHP 60,000 from this farming. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to pay the labor costs for weeding and to purchase fertilizers.

Nida has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Nida hopes to gain more income and expand her business.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for weeding and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Nerling

texts.en:
Nerling is 31 years old.  She is married and has 4 children who are currently going to school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Nerling runs a business buying and selling ginger in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  Nerling has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ginger to sell.   In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy ginger

loans.name: Benelyn

texts.en: Benelyn is married and a mother of two school-aged dependents. Benelyn is 32 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. To earn a living, she has a small market and a video-k at home for entertainment. She had this business for seven years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 in this business. Benelyn has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase refreshments to sell. Benelyn has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Benelyn hopes to expand her business and have another store in the town.

loans.use: To purchase refreshments to sell.

loans.name: Dina Roxana

texts.es: Dina Roxana D. veintiocho años D. edad vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda con la que mantiene a flote su hogar, es un negocio muy rentable y ya tiene mucha clientela pues el lugar donD. lo tiene establecido es muy concurrido D. personas. Dina siempre tiene los mejores productos y en variedad, los clientes la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que ellos necesitan y por supuesto a precios accesibles. Para Dina Roxana las cosas más bellas en la vida se obtienen con el esfuerzo y la dedicación; el trabajo duro trae las mejores satisfacciones es por eso que ella se encuentra decidida y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mas mercadería como granos básicos, azúcar, golosinas, pan, productos instantáneos, bebidas, entre otros; así logrará que poco a poco su negocio vaya creciendo y cumplirá una D. sus grandes metas en la vida. Dina tiene la confianza que si su trabajo es viable lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica además D. una vida plena.
texts.en: Dina Roxana is 28 years old and lives in her own home with her two children.  She has a store that keeps her household afloat.  It is a very profitable business and she has many customers since her store is located in a very busy place.  Dina always has the best products and variety.  Her customers prefer her because she always has what they need and of course, at affordable prices.  For Dina Roxana, the most beautiful things in life are obtained through hard work and dedication and hard work brings with it satisfaction.  It is for this reason that she decided to request a loan from Integral.  This will allow her to buy more merchandise such as basic grains, sugar, candy, bread, instant products, beverages, and other things.  This way, little by little, she will be able to grow her business and achieve one of her greatest goals in life.  Dina has confidence that if her work is viable she will be able to give her family financial security as well as a full life.

loans.use: purchase basic grains, sugar, candy, bread, instant products and beverages.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 39 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and a mother of one school-aged child. Vilma has a small market at home to make a living. She sells basic food items like canned goods, milk, coffee, sweets and biscuits. Vilma has been engaged in this type of business for five years. She earns a total monthly average of PHP 2,200. Vilma has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase stock to sell. Vilma has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Vilma hopes to expand her business and gain more profits.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: María Noemí

texts.es: María Noemí D. treinta y uno años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta D. fruta, verdura, pollo, huevos, los venD. D. manera ambulante en las colonias cercanas a donD. ella resiD. ya se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues venD. producto D. buena calidad, fresco y por supuesto a precio accesible, María les da un buen servicio a las personas que compran su producto las atienD. con gran amabilidad y siempre con una sonrisa en el rostro. Para María Noemí lo que importa es cuanto amor, esfuerzo y dedicación le pongamos al trabajo que realizamos para que en un futuro tengamos una transformación exitosa en nuestras vidas, es por eso que con ese pensamiento positivo se deciD. solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mas mercadería como fruta, verdura, huevos, pollo, carnes entre otros. María tiene la confianza que su trabajo le dará la posibilidad D. darle a su familia una calidad D. vida mejor y una estabilidad económica para su hogar.
texts.en:
María Noemí is 31 years old, and she lives with her life partner and their children.  She sells fruit, vegetables, chicken, and eggs.  She sells in an itinerant manner in the neighborhoods close to where she lives.  She has already gotten a lot of customers because she sells good quality products that are fresh. Of course, she sells at an accessible price.

María gives good service to the people who buy her products.  She waits on them with great kindness, and she always has a smile on her face.  What is important to María Noemí is how much love, effort, and dedication we put into our work.  We do this so that in the future we will have a successful change in our lives.

That is why, with a positive outlook, she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL.  The loan will allow her to buy more merchandise like fruit, vegetables, eggs, chicken, and meat, among other things.  María is confident that her work will give her the chance to give her family a better quality of life and financial stability in her household.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, eggs, chicken, and meat.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 32 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four school-aged dependents. Alma has a buy and sell business. She sells clothing. She sells ready to wear clothes, bedclothes, and curtains. Alma has had this business for two years with a monthly income of PHP 10,000. She has requested a loan of 20,000 from GDMPC to purchase clothes to sell. Alma has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Alma hopes to expand her clothing business and have a clothing shop in her town.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 48 years-old and married. She lives in the town of Panglao, Bohol. She has had a sari-sari store business for 10 years. She sells items such as packed noodles, eggs and softdrinks to the people in her community. Ma. Elena also raises pigs in her backyard. She sells the pigs at her town's local market.

Ma. Elena has requested a loan to purchase pig feed and more items to sell such as rice and canned goods. She hopes for her store and piggery to grow.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and items to sell such as rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Emerma

texts.en:
Emerma is 41 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of one school-age child.
Emerma works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 in this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to pay for the labor cost for fishing boat repair. Emerma has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Emerma hopes to purchase a brand new fishing boat.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for fishing boat repair

loans.name: Tatiana Rosibel

texts.es: Tatiana Rosibel de veintiséis años de edad vive con sus dos hijos. Ella posee una venta de cosméticos en variedad, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente pues la prefieren porque vende productos de muy buena calidad, novedosos y a precios bajos, además Tatiana es una mujer muy carismática emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante trata a sus clientes con lo mejor de sí. Tatiana piensa y tiene muy claro que el mundo está en manos de aquellos que tienen el coraje de soñar y de correr el riesgo de vivir sus sueños y su pensamiento la ha motivado a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cosméticos de toda variedad como, sombras, rubor, base facial, lápiz labial, delineador, todo por mayor porque así obtiene precios más accesibles, es una buena forma para que no decepcione a los clientes y siempre se mantenga al frente de la competencia. Tatiana tiene la esperanza que su trabajo le dará la oportunidad de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Tatiana Rosibel is 26 years old, and she lives with her two children.  She sells a variety of cosmetics.  She has acquired lots of customers now.  They prefer her because she sells very good quality products at low prices.  

Tatiana is a very charismatic and enterprising woman with the desire to get ahead.  She takes care of her customers by giving the best of herself.  Tatiana believes, and it is very clear to her, that the world is in the hands of those who have the courage to dream and to run the risk of living their dreams.

This thought has motivated her to request a loan from INTEGRAL.  A loan will allow her to buy a complete variety of cosmetics like eye shadow, blush, foundation, lipstick, and eye liner.  She will buy everything wholesale because that is the way she gets more accessible prices.  This is a good way to buy so that she does not disappoint the customers and to always stay ahead of the competition.

Tatians has the hope that her work will give her the opportunity to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy eye shadow, blush, foundation, lipstick, and eye liner.

loans.name: Ena Fe

texts.en:
Ena Fe is 30 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

Ena Fe runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  She has been running this business for 2 years.  She also earns an income from raising pigs.  

Ena Fe has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like bread, detergent and other miscellaneous items to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid 7 previous loans from NWTF before this loan.  

Ena Fe aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy stock for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 52 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nora is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nora has been farming rice for four years and earns additional income from buying & selling fruit.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en:
Ma. Nancy is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Nancy is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ma. Nancy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Nancy requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her stall.

Ma. Nancy has been in this business for five years. Ma. Nancy would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her stall

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Norhanena

texts.en:
Norhanena is 53 years old and married with four children.

Norhanena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items for her sari-sari store.

Norhanena has borrowed and paid back 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 30 years and earns additional income from farming coconut.

Norhanena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Nancy Yaneth

texts.es: Nancy Yaneth D. veintinueve años D. edad vive con sus hijos los cuales asisten a una escuela cercana a donD. residen. Ella posee una venta D. empanadas y ha empezado la venta D. pupusas tiene mucha clientela pues lo que prepara lo hace con un sabor exquisito muy aseado y a precio accesible. Para Nancy luchar por un futuro mejor y alcanzar el triunfo es su más granD. meta es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materiales como plátanos, frijoles, leche, azúcar, maíz, queso, chicharrón, D. esta manera  ella podrá seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades D. sus clientes y estará más cerca D. cumplir su meta. Nancy tiene la confianza que todo su esfuerzo le permitirá darle a su familia una vida plena y una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Nancy Yaneth is 29 years old, and she lives with her children.  The children go to a school that is close to where they live.

She sells empanadas, and she has started selling “pupusas” (corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, beans, and pork, then grilled).  She has lots of customers.  The food she prepares has an exquisite flavor, is sumptuous, and has an accessible price. 

Nancy’s biggest goal is to fight for a better future and to triumph.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Intergral.  The loan will allow her to buy food like bananas, beans, milk, sugar, corn, cheese, and “chicharrón” (fried pork rinds).  That way she will be able to continue meeting her customers’ needs, and she will be closer to achieving her goal.

Nancy is confident that all of her efforts will allow her to give her family a fulfilling life and financial stability.

loans.use: to buy bananas, beans, milk, sugar, corn, cheese, and “chicharrón” (fried pork rinds).

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Emerma is 41 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of one school-age child. Emerma works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 in this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to pay for the labor costs for fishing boat repair. Emerma has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Emerma hopes to purchase a brand new fishing boat.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock and refreshment to sell.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a shells crafting business in the Philippines for 6 years. She earns additional income from food vending. Jonalyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her business.

Jonalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shells crafting business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita works hard to support her family. She is married and has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for 40 years. Anita has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and equipment. In the future, Anita would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en: Norlita is 42 years old and married, with 7 children. She has been farming rice for 6 years and also earns additional income from farming coconut. Norlita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married and works hard to support her family. She has operated a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines for 3 years. Elizabeth has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, detergent, vinegar, etc. to sell. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, detergent, vinegar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Razilda

texts.en: Razilda is 41 years old and married, with 8 children. She has been rice farming for 4 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and dried fish businesses. Razilda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, buttons, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma, 42 years old, is married, with 1 child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emma has operated a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines for 8 years. Emma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase toothpaste, detergent, seasonings and other miscellaneous items to sell. Emma  would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase toothpaste, detergent, seasonings and other miscellaneous items to sell

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta is 55 years-old and married. She lives in the town of Panglao, Bohol with her family. Her husband is a farmer.

Norberta runs a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) and has had this business for five years. This business earns about 5,000 PHP per month. Norberta also helps her husband tend their farm. They also own cows that help in tilling the land.

Norberta is asking for a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts such as tires and to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In the future, Norberta hopes for her business to improve.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts such as tires and pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en: Eufemia works hard to support her family. She is single and has operated a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines for 5 years. Eufemia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy grocery stock such as eggs, toothpaste, shampoo, etc. In the future, Eufemia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery stock such as eggs, toothpaste, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es: Orbelina D. cuarenta y dos años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una panadería muy conocida en la localidad pues venD. un pan exquisito a muy buen precio, tiene variedad D. panes para el gusto del cliente, Orbelina es muy servicial siempre recibe a las personas con gran amabilidad y con una sonrisa en el rostro, además el lugar D. su trabajo es muy aseado y muy adecuado para preparar ese pan que los clientes esperan todos los días. Orbelina vive para luchar y cumplir sus sueños es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material como harina, levadura, azúcar, bandejas, gas propano, entre otros, D. esta manera siempre estará a la expectativa D. las personas. Orbelina tiene fe que su arduo trabajo le ayudara a darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Orbelina, age 42, lives with her life partner and their children in their own house.

She has a bakery, which is very well-known in the area.  She sells delicious bread at a very good price.  She has a variety of breads to suit her customers’ tastes.  Orbelina is very obliging.  She always receives people with great kindness and with a smile on her face.  Also, her work place is very clean and well set up to prepare the bread that her customers expect every day.

Orbelina lives to struggle on in order to fulfill her dreams.  That is why she decided to request a loan from Integral.  The loan will allow her to buy materials like flour, leavening, sugar, trays, and propane gas, among other items.  This way she will always meet people’s expectations.  Obelina has faith that her arduous work will help her give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, leavening, sugar, trays, and propane gas.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a fruit vending business in the Philippines for 20 years. She earns more income from coconut farming. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell. Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy wood, foam and paint for her fishing boat. Grace has been in this business for 16 years. She earns income from fish vending.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy wood, foam and paint for her fishing boat.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: As the widowed parent of one child, Sally works hard to support her family. She has a welding shop business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store. Sally is borrowing 24,500 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy materials for her welding shop like welding rods, plain sheets and other equipment. Sally has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her welding shop.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en: Luna is 34 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Luna has a fishing business in the Philippines. Luna requested a 11,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment. Luna has been in this business for four years. In the future, Luna would like to save enough money so she can purchase an additional fishing boat for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Mariza

texts.en: Ma. Mariza is 46 years old and married with four children. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Mariza requested a 18,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs. Ma. Mariza has been raising pigs for 2 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Ma. Mariza would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a barbecue vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. Teresita has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, Teresita would like to expand her business and save money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 36 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz Jiminez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of three school-age children. Gemma runs a motorcycle transport business to make a living. She earns approximately PHP 6,600 a month doing this type of work. She has been running this business for over two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase motorcycle tires and spare parts. Gemma has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Gemma hopes to purchase another motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Hugo Alberto

texts.es: Hugo Alberto de cuarenta años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. El posee una venta de sorbete artesanal que junto a su esposa preparan en su misma casa y posteriormente distribuye en  diferentes colegios y universidades, ya tiene mucha clientela pues lo prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan los jovenes estudiantes, exquisitos sabores naturales y a precios accesibles, de coco, tamarindo, arrayan, nance, entre otros, Hugo es muy servicial y atento con sus clientes. Es un hombre de trabajo que se levanta desde muy temprano a ganarse el pan de cada día,  él piensa que hay que disfrutar el trabajo que nos lleva al éxito por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mayor cantidad de materias primas como hielo, azucar, jarabes y frutas, para producir mayor cantidad de helados, así crezca el negocio y siempre tenga lo que sus clientes demanden. Hugo Alberto tiene la confianza que esta es la mejor forma de llevar a su hogar estabilidad económica y una mejor vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Hugo Alberto is forty years old and lives with his life partner and children in his own house.  He owns a business selling handmade sorbets that he and his wife prepare in their home to then distribute to different schools and universities.  He has a lot of customers because they prefer his product since he always has what the young students need, and exquisite natural flavors at reasonable prices.  He sells sorbets made from coconut, tamarind, myrtle, and nance, among others.  

Hugo is very service-oriented and attentive to his customers.  He is a worker that rises very early in order to be a breadwinner each day.  He believes that one must enjoy the work that brings us success.  This why he requests a loan through INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy a greater quantity of raw materials such as ice, sugar, syrups and fruits to make more of his ices.  This way, his business will grow and he’ll have what the customers demand.  

Hugo Alberto has confidence that this is the best way to bring financial stability to his home and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: buy ice, sugar, syrups and fruits.

loans.name: Prim

texts.en:
Prim, 49 years-old, is making a traditional Khmer instrument she sells with her husband. One instrument costs $35 and she can make one instrument a day with her husband but this does not mean she can sell one per day. The income in her family is not regular because it depend on the tourist season. Most of her customers are foreigners. 

She has four children, all of whom are studying in school. Every month, she spends $110 on food, $115 on school fees, and $30 on other expenses in the family. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 in order to buy woods and materials for making the Khmer instrument to sell. She wants to extend her business and sell to customers herself which will bring more benefit then selling through others.

loans.use: to buy woods and materials for making a traditional Khmer instrument.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en: Cristine is 29 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with one school-age child. Cristine works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years with a monthly income of PHP 5,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay the labor costs for repairing her fishing boat machine. Cristine has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Cristine hopes to purchase additional fishing boats.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for repairing her fishing boat

loans.name: Rosalba Raquel

texts.es: Rosalba Raquel D. treinta y dos años D. edad vive con su esposo y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda con la cual colabora a la economía D. su hogar; esta es muy visitada por las personas del lugar pues siempre encuentran lo que necesitan, productos en variedad, D. muy buena calidad y sobre todo a precios accesibles; Rosalba es una mujer muy carismática recibe a los clientes con el mejor D. los gustos. Para ella las batallas más importantes en la vida son las que peleamos diariamente con nuestra dedicación en el trabajo, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita surtir su tienda con pan, golosinas, harina, azúcar, granos básicos, lácteos, bebidas entre otros D. esta manera su negocio crecerá y tiene fe que lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Rosalba Raquel is thirty-two years old and lives with her husband and children in her own house.  She has a general store that helps her contribute toward the household’s finances; it is visited often by area residents, since they can always find what they need there, a variety of high-quality products at reasonable prices.

Rosalba is a very charismatic woman who greets customers with great cheer.  For her, life’s most important battles are those that we fight on a daily basis through our dedication to our work.  For this reason, she turns to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to supply her store with bread, sweets, flour, sugar, basic grains, dairy products and beverages, among other items.  In this manner, her business will grow and she has faith that she will manage to proviD. her family with a higher standard of living.

loans.use: buy bread, sweets, flour, sugar, basic grains, dairy products and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en: Edison is 42 years old and lives in Culpan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with three grown children. Edison has a motorcycle transport service. He has owned and operated the service for 10 years. He earns approximately PHP 10,200 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 from GDMPC to purchase a brand new motorcycle. Edison has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Edison hopes to gain more profit and purchase more motorcycles for transport.

loans.use: To purchase a brand new motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 31 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of two school-age children.
Jenifer works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She sells fish in the local community every morning. She has been running this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,500 in this business. Jenifer has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase additional fishing nets. Jenifer has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Jenifer hopes to purchase a fishing boat and gain more profit.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Reyna Marlene

texts.es: Reyna Marlene de treinta y seis años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija la cual asiste a una escuela cercana de la localidad. Ella posee una venta de ropa tiene de diferentes estilos y  para todas las personas damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, la ropa que comercia es de muy buena calidad y la vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente; Reyna es muy activa siempre se encuentra trabajando luchando por salir adelante. Para Reyna el propósito y coraje que le pone a su labor tiene una dirección ver crecer el negocio para lograr un mejor futuro, es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa en variedad como faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, trajes etc. Así siempre podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Reyna tiene la esperanza que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida plena.
texts.en:
Reyna Marlene is 36 years old.  She lives with her life’s companion and her daughter who goes to school nearby.  She sells clothes in assorted styles for everyone: women, men, boys and girls.  The clothes she sells are of very good quality and she sells them at affordable prices.  Because of this, she’s attained quite a few customers lately.

Reyna is very active and is always working to get ahead.  For Reyna, the purposefulness and courage she puts into her work is directed toward the business’ growth in order to attain a better future.  This is why she decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy a variety of clothes like skirts, pants, blouses, t-shirts, suits, etc. so that she will always be able to meet customer demand.  Reyna hopes that she will be able to provide her family with economic security and a fulfilled life this way.

loans.use: to buy skirts, pants, blouses, t-shirts and suits.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a 45-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Panglao, Bohol. She has been in the business of raising hogs for five years. She plans to use her loan to buy pig feed and vitamins. Vicenta hopes to earn better so she can buy the things they need at home. 

In the future, Vicenta hopes to expand her piggery. She also hopes for her children to get a college degree and find jobs.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
Vong, 46 years old, is a pig breeder and a farmer in the rainy season.  Her income is $4.  She is a single mother with 3 children who are  20, 17, and 16 years old. All of them are working as construction workers and can make $3 per day each.   Every month, Vong has to spend $75 on food, and $15 on transportation.

She would like  a loan of $800 to buy pig food and fertilizer for her field. She hopes to raise more pigs to make more income and be able to send all of her children to study.

loans.use: to buy pig food and fertilizer for her field

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis Alonso de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El se dedica al negocio ambulante, el comercia sandalias de todo tipo y estilo además de zapatos, todo de muy buena calidad y a muy buen precio; Luis ya tiene mucha clientela pues se caracteriza por ser muy buen vendedor, muy carismático siempre adelante de su competencia. Luis piensa que una vida llena de éxitos solo la posee aquel que se esfuerza por conseguir sus sueños, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar sandalias y zapatos de diferentes colores y estilos para seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de la clientela. Luis Alonso tiene la confianza que su duro trabajo le permitirá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Luis Alonso is 43 years old.  He lives with his life companion and their children.  He is a vendor selling all types and styles of sandals; he also sells shoes.  Everything is very good quality and at very good prices.  Luis has quite a few customers because he’s a very good seller, quite charismatic and always ahead of the competition.  

Luis believes that a successful life is only attainable by those who strive to reach their dreams.  Because of this he’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy sandals and shoes of various colors and styles to continue satisfying customer needs.  Luis Alonso is confident that his hard work will make it possible for him to provide his family with a fulfilled life.

loans.use: to buy sandals and shoes.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan, 30 years old, is a cook. Her husband is a construction worker.   Their income is $8 per day. They have 4 children, all of whom are in school. Every month, she has to spend $38 on food, $13 on school fees, and $15 on other expenses. She would like a loan of $900 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to travel to work. Besides working as construction worker, her husband wants to drive his motorbike as a taxi so that there would be more income for the family. She plans to send all of her children to study through the university level.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work

loans.name: Claudia María

texts.es: Claudia María D. cuarenta y cuatro años D. edad vive con su familia. Ella posee una sala D. belleza y venta D. productos para el cuidado personal; es la mejor estilista D. la zona pues la prefieren por la calidad D. trabajo que realiza y claro por los precios accesibles, sus clientes siempre terminan satisfechos con su trabajo y con el buen servicio que Claudia les presta. Para ella el éxito no es la clave D. la felicidad. La felicidad es la clave del éxito. Si amas lo que haces serás exitoso; y su labor es lo que más ama en la vida es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cremas, cosméticos, peines, acondicionadores, shampoo entre otros D. esta forma mantendrá a flote el negocio y podrá seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad D. la clientela. Claudia María tiene la confianza que con esto lograra llevar seguridad económica para su familia.
texts.en: Claudia María is forty-four years old and lives with her family.  She has a beauty salon and sells personal care products; she is the best stylist in the area because customers prefer the quality of work that she does and of course her affordable rates.  Her customers always wind up satisfied with her work and with the good service that Claudia provides.  For her, success is not the key to happiness, happiness is the key to success.  If you love what you do, you will be successful, and her work is what she loves most in life.  This is why she is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL which will allow her to purchase creams, cosmetics, combs, conditioners, shampoo and others things like this.  This will allow the business to remain afloat, and it will be able to continue to meet the needs of its customers.  Claudia María is confident that this loan could potentially lead to economic security for her family.

loans.use: to buy creams, conditioners, combs, conditioners and shampoo.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 38 year-old mother who is blessed with 2 children. She has a retail shop where she sells dry goods, like pants, t-shirts, blouses, jackets, underwear and skirts. She has been in this business for almost 4 years. 

Lorna is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional goods to sell, like pants, t-shirts, blouses and jackets. Each month, Lorna earns about PHP 8,000 by selling different kinds of clothes.

In the future, Lorna hopes to strengthen this kind of business in order to supplement the income of her husband.  She will use it for tuition fees and allowances for their children. She hopes that someday, through the continuous support and assistance of the Kiva lenders, her business will grow and their children will finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell, like pants, T-shirts, blouses and jackets

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar is a hardworking woman who trades in the market. Dilbar sells women’s clothes of national fashions popular among the people of her region. Also, she sews traditional women’s dresses at home and then sells them. Dilbar has been running her business for 17 years.  She has rich experience in this business. Dilbar would like to get a loan to purchase new seasonal women’s clothes. 

 More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy seasonal women’s clothes

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is a 57-year-old businesswoman and local farmer in the Baray district. She and her husband have owned and operated their retail business for over two years. They sell many kinds of goods to passersby and other villagers who reside next to their community. The items that they sell are cooking ingredients, shampoo, soft drink, candy, and some essential goods. They always help each other to earn money to meet the financial demands of the family. From this business they can earn net income of about US$5 per day.  

This couple have a good attitude and they are always forming relationships with their neighbors so that they attract extra clients who come to buy their goods. In order to make their fixed goods retail business successful and to earn more income, Chan would like to apply for loan funds so she can purchase more items such as cooking ingredients, shampoo, soft drink and candy in order to continue selling.

loans.use: to purchase items such as cooking ingredients, shampoo, soft drink and candy to sell.

loans.name: Sharaf

texts.en:
Sharaf is 26 years old and he is married. He is engaged in selling men’s sport shoes. Sharaf works hard and he tries to expand his business and increase his working capital in order to make a good profit. He would like a loan of 4500 TJS  to purchase new fashionable men’s sport shoes. Sharaf is thankful to Kiva lenders who will support him and allow him to keep his family in good living conditions. 

 More about Tajikistan and IMON International

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy new men’s sport shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant a rice crop and repair her old motorbike.

loans.name: Ngoem

texts.en: Mrs. Ngoem is a 41-year-old married woman and mother. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother and she always uses this land to plant different kinds of crops at least twice a year. Her husband assists with the crop-planting business. In addition, Mrs. Ngoem occasionally goes around her village to buy some used goods and sell them to her regular wholesaler for a profit. The couple is married and has seven children. One of the children is single and the other six children are married. As her present saving is not enough to plant her crops, Mrs. Ngoem would like a loan to buy a sack fertilizer, seeds and other farming material to support her in the farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and other farming material

loans.name: Sharafniso

texts.en:
Sharafniso is married and the mother of two children. She is an honest and responsible woman. For 25 years she has been running her business buying and selling seeds.  Sharafniso wants to expand her business and to make a good profit. She would like a loan of 5500 TJS for purchasing seeds in order to increase the assortment of seeds. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: to buy seeds for retail

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
Karomat is 52 years old woman who is married. Since her husband works in Russia, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle. Currently she has two cows and four sheep. She has a land, which she cultivates for fattening her cattle. Now Karomat wants to expand her business and since her children are grown up she thinks that she will be able for looking after more cattle with their help. Therefore, she is for asking 4000 TJS in order to purchase sheep. Karomat expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and she promises to repay the loan in time. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Batkhishig

texts.en:
Batkhishig is a 33-year-old married man with two children, aged four and nine. He and his wife operate a business together at Kharkhorin, the local outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, with two stalls at a rented space selling underclothing, sunglasses and school supplies.  

His family used to live in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) at another person’s land plot. Since then their business has expanded, hence with their business earnings, he bought a small plot and built their first house. 

Batkhishig is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) loan to buy vacuum-insulated windows, a sliding metal door and other necessary materials to fix and renovate his small house. By doing so, their family can enjoy safe and comfortable living conditions.

Since he started his business in 2007, Batkhishig’s life has considerably improved. He is a bright and hard-working man who is willing to raise his children in a good environment and with the help of this loan, he will get the opportunity to finish his housing project.

loans.use: to buy vacuum-insulated windows, a sliding metal door and other necessary materials to fix and renovate his small house

loans.name: Edelborgo

texts.en: Edelborgo is 57-year-old married man who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family. He is a farmer and has been growing rice for 30 years already. According to Edelborgo, his recent income from the farm is 3000 PHP per month. Edelborgo wants to improve his earnings and he works hard to achieve it. He is requesting the loan to fund his farm. He plans to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs with his loan. Edelborgo hopes for this loan to help increase his harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosa has been in this business for 29 years.

She has requested a PHP 18,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. Rosa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Morombi

texts.en:
Morombi is 27 years old. He is married with two children. He is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last six years.

He learned about KADET from the registered KADET groups. This will be his third loan which he is planning to spend to prepare land for tomato plants. Tomato has been doing well in his area due to good climate conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to improve his living standards and education of his children, and to expand his business.

His dream is to prosper in the business of tomato farming. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for tomato planting.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 59 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Violeta has a business in which she buys and sells soft drinks in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

Violeta has requested a loan amount of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of soft drink to sell. Violeta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of soft drink to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Maysaa

texts.en:
Maysaa is a 24-year-old single lady who lives with her family. Her mother has been embroidering traditional dresses and knitting for over 20 years. Maysaa has inherited her mom’s talent and has always watched her since childhood to learn from her mom. Three years ago, Maysaa decided to help her mom increase business by marketing the dresses and then make and help her with the embroidery to get the order done on time. 

Now Maysaa is applying for this loan to buy more embroidery material and fabric to have more products on hand, since she is planning to market her business outside Jordan also.

loans.use: To buy more embroidery material and fabric

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Vilma works hard to support her family. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Vilma is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fruits for her fruit vending business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy crates of sodas for her bar.

loans.name: Procora

texts.en:
Procora is 46 years old and has a fish-selling business. This business has been running for five years.

Procora has six children. The oldest is 28 and the youngest is 15.

Procora earns about 6,000 PHP per month and works hard to support her family. She has requested this loan to buy ice, cellophanes and more fish to sell.

In the future, Procora hopes to have her children finish college.

loans.use: to buy ice, cellophane and more fish to sell

loans.name: Rosvilla

texts.en:
Rosvilla, aged 42, is married with four children, two of whom attend school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has a business in which she buys and sells coconuts in the Philippines. Rosvilla has been in this business for three years. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more coconuts to sell in her stall.

In the future, Rosvilla would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell in her stall

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business in which she sells ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Jasmin has been in this business for three years.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like pants, t-shirts, blouses, etc. to sell. In the future, Jasmin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items like pants, t-shirts, blouses etc. to sell

loans.name: Mergen

texts.ru: Мерген проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 27 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Он вместе со своей семьей занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где сеет рис, пшеницу и выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Mergen lives in the Jilikul region. He is 27 years old. He is married and has two children. Together with his family he grows crops. He rents out a plot of land where he sows rice, wheat and grows vegetables. He has been in this business for ten years. He is taking out the loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Milagros has been in this business for five years.

Milagros has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Ma. Nilda

texts.en:
Ma. Nilda is 58 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ma. Nilda has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Ma. Nilda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion, aged 51, is married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Consolacion has a variety store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like biscuits, candies, curls, shampoo, cereals, etc. to sell in her variety store. Consolacion has been in this business for 25 years. 

In the future, Consolacion would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like biscuits, candies, curls, shampoo, cereals, etc. to sell in her variety store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 33 years old .He is married and a father of two children.

He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last five years. His farm is in a productive area, which has proved to be good for wheat farming. He learned about KADET through KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan. He is planning to use the loan to prepare his wheat farming. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming, to increase his wheat production and educate his children. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer.

Dickson is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to prepare his land for wheat farming

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a 32-year-old single male with one child living in a rented house in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a video hall where people can watch movies. He has been in this business for six years, having started with 800,000 shillings worth of capital. He now has 1,600,000 shillings. His hardship is lack of enough capital. His vision is business expansion, buying land and building a house for his family. Fred needs a loan to enable him to buy chairs and a flat screen for his video hall.

loans.use: To buy chairs and a flat screen for his video hall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sodas

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.en:
Nozigul lives and works in Kurgantube, Tajikistan. She owns a business selling shoes at the local market called “Barakat”. Her clients helped her to stay afloat with this business for six years. Nozigul decided to go into this line of business because it gives her a good profit. She believes that increasing her assorted shoes will guarantee increased sales and consistent development of her business. Nozigul is requesting a loan of 4,000 TJS in order to increase her working capital. 
                                                                                    
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new shoes to sell

loans.name: Lasiti

texts.en:
Lasiti is 40 years old. He is married and a father of two children. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last four years. His farm is in a productive area that has proved to be good for wheat farming. He learned about KADET through a KADET customer who was already registered. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to use to prepare his wheat farm.

He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer, buy a bigger piece of land and build a plot. He is an energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to prepare his land for wheat farming

loans.name: Toirjon

texts.en:
Toirjon is a hardworking husband who is engaged in processing fruits. He works hard and his family helps in this business. This business is a family business. In the season, he purchases about 3000-3500 kg of fresh fruit. After processing, he has 700-850 kg dried fruit and 350 kg ossicle. From the profit that he made last year, he built two houses. Toirjon would like to get a loan of 4,000 TJS to purchase fresh apricots for processing. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy fresh apricots to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 33 years old and a hard working businesswoman. She is married and blessed with eight children. She has been selling small fish (omena) for the last two years. She expects to expand her business in the next five years and her dream is to be able to purchase a plot. She has requested 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more small fish (omena).

loans.use: To buy small fish (omena)

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, a 28-year-old cosmetics seller, is the divorced mother of two children, 11 and 8 years old. Her monthly expenses include $30 for food, $5 for electricity, $10 for  house rent, $10 for school fees, $10 for transportation, and $15 for other expenses. 

Sophea is requesting a loan of $500 to buy cosmetic products to sell. Her career is going well, and she expects to extend her career by selling more cosmetic products to earn more income to support her two children when they go to university.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Furkat

texts.en:
Furkat has been running a business processing dried fruit for 13 years. He is a hardworking man and he tries to process his fruits carefully. As a result, he can make a high quality dried fruit. Furkat purchases 15,000-16,000 kg of fresh fruits and after processing, he gets 3500-4000 kg dried fruits and 1600 kg ossicle. From the profit that he made, he bought a car. Currently, Furkat would like a loan of 4,000 TJS for purchasing fresh fruits for processing in order to expand his business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy fresh fruit to process and sell

loans.name: Joash

texts.en: Joash is 43 years old and he has been running a grocery shop for the last two years. He is married and a proud father of three children aged 18, 7 and 5. He believes that with his hard work and commitment, he will be able to expand his business to reach out to a wider market, generate more profit and invest in other sectors of the economy. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for giving him a sense of direction on how to run his business efficiently and effectively.  He has requested 15,000 Kenyan shillings to buy tomatoes, avocado and onions.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, avocado and onions

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson has been selling electrical goods for the last two years. He supplements this earning with income from his water vending and motorbike transport business. He is a hard working and an aggressive 25-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with one child aged one year. He wants 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy mobile phone chargers, sockets and bulbs. 

He wants, in the next five years, to expand his business into wholesale and be able to earn enough to purchase his own piece of land. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been enlightened on how to manage his business well.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone chargers, sockets and bulbs.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 58-year-old businesswoman married to Kimani, who contributes to the family income. They are blessed with six adult children. Catherine has been buying and selling new clothes for the past eleven years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family members and sustain her business.

Catherine is applying for her second loan with KADET, having repaid the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to add new clothing stock to her business. Catherine will use the anticipated profit from the business to feed her family and to stock up her business. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her family's living standard and to be financially sustainable.

loans.use: to add new clothing stock to her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 27 years old and is married with one child who is one year old. Rose sells shoes such as children's shoes and has been in this business for three years. She works from 6am until 5pm every day.

Rose has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more children's shoes and adults' shoes to sell. With this profit, Rose will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more children's shoes and adults' shoes to sell.

loans.name: Baatartsogt

texts.en:
Baatartsogt, age 38, lives with his family in the outer district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He works as a machinist at a local private company while he is also an experienced carpenter who manufactures different kinds of custom wood finished products at home. His wife stays at home while their 4-year-old daughter attends kindergarten and their oldest daughter goes to public secondary school. He earns profit from his full-time job at the company as well as from his private business. 

Recently, Baatartsogt has been working on the extension of his small house by himself. He has already built the new wall which is made up of bricks and block-stones. The home extension also involves the roof construction. Therefore, to finish his housing project, he is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy essential materials for the construction, roof covering and interior structure as well. 

He wants his children to enjoy living in the house and to be able to support them as far as he can to make them highly-educated people.

loans.use: to buy necessary construction materials to finish his housing project

loans.name: Wambui

texts.en:
Wambui is a 34-year-old businesswoman married to Patrick, who contributes to the family income. They are blessed with two children, 13 and 15 years old. Wambui has been running a hotel for the past five years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000, which she uses to support her family members.

Wambui is applying for her third loan with KADET, having repaid her previous loans successfully. Wambui will use the loan to stock up on cooking oil and wheat flour and to purchase a television. She plans to use the anticipated profit from her business to construct her own house and relocate the family. Her hopes and dreams are to purchase a piece of land and construct a big hotel in her home town.

loans.use: to stock up on cooking oil and wheat flour and to purchase a television

loans.name: Rikaton

texts.en:
Rikaton, 43 years old, is married to Lesoyo and they are blessed with children. Rikaton owns a shop in Enkaroni where she has been selling clothes for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000.

Rikaton was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000, which she plans to use to purchase more clothes for sale. She will use the extra profit to open another shop in Namanga. Rikaton hopes to become a big wholesaler. She is very hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Djéweriatou

texts.fr: Revendeuse à domicile et au grand marché de Lomé, Djéweriatou est née à Sokodé et est âgée de 34 ans et célibataire, mère d’un enfant. Revendeuse de pagnes, elle s’approvisionne aussi bien sur place au grand marché de Lomé qu’au Mali. Débuté depuis 2005, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour augmenter son étalage et augmenter sa clientèle. Elle espère avoir des jours meilleurs avec son enfant.
texts.en: Reseller at home and at the main market in Lome, Djéweriatou was born in Sokode and is 34 years old, single, and mother of one child.  Reseller of pagne (traditional cloth), she stocks up as well on-site at the main market in Lome as she does in Mali.  Since starting her business in 2005, she is asking for this first loan to expand her display of goods and to increase her customer base.  She hopes to have better days with her child.

loans.use: to buy pagne and bazin (two types of cloth)

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson, 29 years old, is married to Ruth and they are blessed with one child. Dickson is a livestock trader in Enkaroni. He has been selling livestock such as goats for the last four years, earning a monthly income of KES 4,000.

Dickson was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. He is applying for his first  loan of KES 20,000, which he plans to use to purchase more livestock. He will use the anticipated profit to start a ranch. Dickson is very hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 46 years old and is married with three children aged between 3 and 12 years of age. Her business is well-organized. She sells various goods such as soap, peanuts, beans, etc.  Jacqueline has six years' experience and she currently employs four people to help her. She is working from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day.

Jacqueline has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to increase her stock by purchasing various goods such as soap, peanuts, beans, rice, salt, drinks, etc. to sell.  With these profits, Jacqueline will reinvest in her business and save for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as soap, peanuts, beans, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap, 33 years old, is a bread seller. Her husband is a driver and their income is $10 per day. They have two children, 16 and 13 years old, both students. Sopheap's monthly expenses include $112 for food, $10 for electricity, $37 for school fees and $25 for other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a car for her husband to run a taxi business. Sopheap hopes to expand her bread selling so that she has enough money for her children's school fees. She wants to send her children to study until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy a car to run a taxi business

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Mrs. Thai is a 36-year-old small businesswoman who lives in Siem Reap Province. To make a living, she sells meat to people who eat it with beer or wine and other drinks in the village. Her husband earns a daily income by working in a brick kiln as a supervisor. He makes a profit of approximately $3.50 per day to share some responsibility with Mrs. Thai. They are blessed with four children, all of whom are single. One of the children is employed as a temporary staff member for Metfone mobile company. Mrs. Thai would like to seek a loan to add more capital into her current business so she can purchase more meat and drink to sell. Mrs. Thai hopes she can extend the size of her business and construct a new house for her whole family to live in a comfortable house.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and drink to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has been operating a retail shop for the last two years, selling foodstuffs to the people of her local community. She is a hardworking 33-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two school-going children. 

She wants 50,000 KES to buy cooking fat, rice and sugar. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future for more income generation. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to run her business well because she has been trained in business management.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 49-year-old dairy farmer. She is a single mother of a seventeen-year-old daughter. She has been into mixed crop farming for the past year with a monthly income of 5,000 KES (~$56) which she uses for her family's needs.

She is applying for her fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Dorcas will use the loan to buy a dairy cow and practice dairy farming. With the anticipated profit she will support her child’s needs and venture more into dairy farming.

 Her hope is to be a milk supplier in her home town and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and practice dairy farming.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 46-year-old businessman in quarry mining. He is married to Mary. They are blessed with three children, ages thirteen, nine and four. He has been in the business for the past ten years with a monthly income of about 10,000 KES (~$114) which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to purchase tools and equipment for his quarrying business. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children and purchase another quarry area. 

His hopes are to support his family financially and improve their living standard.

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment for his quarrying business.

loans.name: Sindre

texts.en:
Sindre is 33 years old and married to Sampeny. They are blessed with children. She owns a jewelry and animal feeds store in Enkaroni where she operates her business. Most of her clients are females. She gets an income of about 4,000 (~$47) per month.
