Sindre he was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. She has a good credit history with KADET, and she is applying for her second loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD with which she plans to purchase textiles and more animal feeds.

She will use the extra profit to pay school fees for her children. Sindre hopes to start an agrovet (animal clinic). She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase textiles and more animal feeds.

loans.name: Tsogtsaikhan

texts.en:
Tsogtsaikhan is 39 years old and lives with his wife and 3-year-old daughter in his own fenced house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an electrician for Mon-Ted LLC since 1997 and has been operating a chicken farm as well. His wife, Chantsal, is now unemployed and looks after her child. 

Hereafter, he wants to expand his private farming business and built a new house in his fence. Therefore, the loan he is requesting will be used to repair his fencing, build a new barn and heating chimney, and buy a number of chickens. Otherwise, his loan will be dedicated to business enlargement.

loans.use: To repair his fencing, build a new barn and heating chimney, and buy some chickens.

loans.name: Parsimei

texts.en:
Parsimei, aged 43 years, is married and has three children. He has been farming for the past four years. He is a humble client. He knows KADET through other clients registered in his area of dwelling. 

This will be his third loan with KADET, and he intends to spend it by preparing the land for farming and to purchase maize seeds. He anticipates using the profit generated to restock his farm with maize seeds and fertilizers. He dreams of becoming a big farmer. He can do more if provided with resources.

loans.use: purchase maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr: Père d’un enfant et revendeur de profession.il est âgé de 29 ans et est  marié à une coiffeuse. Ayaovi est revendeur des produits de quincaillerie et de vélo dans une boutique  du quartier agoé.il alimente sa boutique par des articles de la place.il a démarré son activité en 2003 et ce deuxième crédit servira à augmenter son stock et mieux servir sa clientèle.
texts.en: Father of one child and a retailer, Ayaovi, is 29 years old and married to a hairdresser.  Ayaovi is a reseller of hardware products and bicycles in a store in the neighborhood of Agoe.  He supplies his shop with articles from the place.  He started his business in 2003 and this second loan will be used to increase his inventory and better serve his customers.

loans.use: to purchase hardware.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is 25 years old and is married with one child who is four years old.  She owns a small business selling shoes. She employs one person from her community as a helper and her hours of business are from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day. This is her third successful year of business.

Furaha has requested the loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more and different shoes such as children's shoes and adults' shoes to sell, especially for women. This loan will allow her to attract more customers which will help her to earn more profit. With this profit, Furaha will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more children's shoes and adults' shoes to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, aged 29 years, is married and has two children. He has been farming for the past four years.
 
He is a humble client. He knew KADET through other clients registered in his area of dwelling. This will be his second loan with KADET, and he intends to spend it by preparing the land for farming and to purchase maize seeds and fertilizer.

Simon anticipates that the profit generated will be used for the farm, and he dreams of being a big farmer. He can do more if provided with resources.

loans.use: to purchase maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tuon

texts.en: From Prey Chor district, Mrs. Tuon is a 48-year-old woman who is good at making Khmer cake and grilled banana at home. Her Khmer cakes are really delicious and she has a lot of valued customers who come to her house to order her cakes and grilled bananas for a ceremony or other party. Mrs. Tuon has more than 10 years of experience in this business and she is able to make an income of about $3 to use for their daily expenses. Some revenues come from her husband’s job as a domestic construction worker in the mobile place. Mrs. Tuon is seeking a loan of $500 to buy more ingredients for making Khmer cakes and to purchase more bananas to grilling and selling. Mrs. Tuon believes she would increase her income by borrowing a Kiva loan. Mrs. Tuon has five children. Two of the children are single and the other three are married.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make Khmer cakes and to buy more bananas to grill and sell

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Dédé a 37 ans et est mère de trois(03) enfants. Mariée à un maçon, elle-même est revendeuse de boissons alcoolisées (liqueurs) au marché d’Agoé Assiyéyé.son activité a commencé en 2000 et pour ses besoins de commerce elle achète ses bouteilles de boissons au grand marché de Lomé. Ce premier crédit auprès de WAGES lui servira à élargir sa clientèle et supporter les charges et les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Dédé is 37 years old and the mother of three. Married to a stonemason, she works as a vendor of alcoholic beverages (liquors) at the  Agoé Assiyéyé. Her business started in 2000. She buys bottles of alcohol at the big market of Lomé. This first loan from WAGES will allow her to expand her customer base and provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy alcoholic beverages (for resale)

loans.name: Nabeel

texts.en:
Nabeel is 35 years old. He is a hard working man who is also the owner of a padding shop for sofas, where he sells good quality sofa covers, fabric and pads.

Since his business field is not a service wanted every day by the same customer, he made sure to have a good reputation with his customers by giving them the best in terms of quality and service. Working on that helps him gain new customers all the time just from his older customer’s word of mouth.

Now, Nabeel has applied for this loan because he has found a good offer to buy a larger quantity of new design fabric at a lower price, which will help him add new fashionable fabric models for his sofas.

loans.use: To buy new fabric and pads for sofas

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en:
Jean Paul is 27 years old and is single. He has owned a store business selling various goods such as cooking oil, bags, kitchen utensils, etc. for the past two years. His business is well-organized and open daily from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m. 

Jean Paul has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as cooking oil, bags, kitchen utensils, lotions, soap, etc. to sell. With the profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as cooking oil, bags, kitchen utensils, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Purevsuren is a 33-year-old divorcee, and she lives with her son and mother in her own private fenced house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is a woman who works hard for her family. Since 2001, she has been selling different kinds of clothes including outerwear, like kids' coats. Sometimes she sews them herself at home. Also, she grows cash crops on her place. 

She has the desire to expand her own business and then provide higher education to her son. The loan she is taking will be used to buy some new commodities for her business and to complete her house repairs.

loans.use: To buy some new commodities for her business and to complete her house repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shirts, trousers and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Agée de 42 ans, Akuvi est mariée est mère de deux(02) enfants. Son mari quant à lui est gendarme. au quotidien Akuvi est revendeuse  d’œufs et d’eau minérale en sachet appelé chez nous  pure water et de l’eau  minérale en bouteille. Pour apporter sa pierre à l’édifice, elle a commencé son activité depuis 2009 et pour se faire s’approvisionne au grand marché puis revend à Agoé Atsanvé dans sa boutique face à la place de vente  des ignames. Elle sollicite à nouveau wages pour augmenter son stock et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: 42 years old, Akuvi is married and mother of 2 children.  Her husband, meanwhile, is a policeman.  On a daily basis Akuvi is a retailer of eggs and packs of mineral water called "Chez Nous Pure Water" and bottled mineral water. To make her contribution, she started her business in 2009 and stocks up at the main market before reselling at Agoe Atsanve in her store opposite the place selling yams.  She is asking for a new loan to increase her inventory and better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy bottled water and trays of eggs.

loans.name: Adidjatou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de profession, Adidjatou est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur. Adidjatou est mère de trois enfants. Elle a commencée son activité de revendeuse de céréales depuis 1990 et pour se faire s’approvisionne à DAPAONG une ville située à 540 km au nord de Lomé puis revend au marché d’Agoé assiyéyé et Agoé Atsanvé.  ce crédit qu’elle sollicite pour une première fois va lui permettre de s’approvisionner en céréales pour desservir  la population environnante en quantité voulue et mieux accompagner son époux dans les tâches ménagères.
texts.en: Adidjatou, a professional merchant, is 44 years old and married to a driver. She is the mother of three children. She began her activity as a merchant of cereals in 1990. She gets her supplies in Dapaong, a city located 540 kilometers north of Lomé, and resells her goods at the markets in Agoé Assiyéyé and Agoé Atsanvé. This loan, which is the first one she applies for, will enable her to buy cereals to appropriately serve the local population. She will better help her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Houmalabé

texts.fr: Jeune femme mariée de 26ans et mère de deux enfants, Houmalabé est revendeuse de charbon de bois devant son domicile depuis 2005 et pour les besoins de son commerce elle s’approvisionne à Sotouboua. Son mari est menuisier  et pour l’aider dans le ménage, elle se bat au quotidien pour supporter les dépenses  du foyer. Elle aimerait augmenter son stock  et pour cela elle sollicite ce crédit auprès de notre institution pour acheter 150 sacs de charbon de bois.
texts.en: Houmalabé is a young lady, aged 26, married and the mother of two children. She has been selling charcoal in front of her house since 2005. She gets the supplies for her business in Sotouboua. Her husband is a carpenter and to help him with household expenses, Houmalabé struggles hard day after day to provide for the family. She would like to increase her inventory and therefore she came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for a loan to buy 150 sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 28 years old and married, with 2 children, 4 and 9 years old. She has no other dependents. Margret rents a house in Hioma, Uganda, where she lives with 5 people.

Margret has been running a produce business for 2 years. She started out with only UGX 200,000 and her working capital has grown over time. She has been able to use the proceeds from her business to complete her house despite the challenge of unstable prices. Margret's dream is to have a bigger food store. She needs a loan to buy rice and beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Koudjoukalou

texts.fr: Mariée à un revendeur  et maman de 06 enfants, Koudjoukalou a 29ans et elle réside à Agoé.  En 2010, elle a ouvert dans son domicile une boutique où elle vend des produits de premières nécessités (sucre, riz, huile végétale). Elle désire voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions. Ce premier  prêt l’aidera à acheter afin de répondre à la demande de ses nombreux clients. Elle s'approvisionne au marché de Lomé.
texts.en: Koudjoukalou is married to a merchant and the mother of six children. She is 29 years old and lives in Agoé. In 2010, she opened a store in her home where she sells basic products (sugar, rice, vegetable oil). She wants to see her children grow up with a stable family background. This is her first loan; it will help her to buy some inventory and meet the demand of her many customers. She gets her supplies at the market in Lomé.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Djaria

texts.fr: Mariée à un commerçant et maman de 02 enfants, Djaria a 29ans et elle réside à Agoé avec son conjoint.  En 2009, elle a ouvert dans son domicile une boutique où elle vend des produits de premières nécessités (sucre, riz, huile végétale). Elle désire voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions. Ce premier  prêt l’aidera à acheter afin de répondre à la demande de ses nombreux clients. Elle s'approvisionne au marché de Lomé.
texts.en: Djaria is married to a merchant and the mother of two children. She is 29 years old and lives in Agoé with her spouse. In 2009, she opened a store in her home where she sells basic products (sugar, rice, vegetable oil). She wants to see her children grow up with a stable family background. This is her first loan; it will help her to buy some inventory and meet the demand of her many customers. She gets her supplies at the market in Lomé.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old and married, with 3 school-aged children. She is a farmer working in the Philippines, earning PHP 4,500 per month. 

Mary is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farm. She has been growing root crops for almost 5 years. In the future, Mary hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to have a higher income to support her family's needs, especially her children's education. She hopes that Kiva lenders will continuously assist her in the business so she will be able to start another kind of business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Hézouwè

texts.fr: Mariée à un comptable et maman de 03 enfants, Hezouwé a 28ans et elle réside à Agoé avec son conjoint.  En 2010, elle a ouvert dans son domicile une boutique où elle vend des produits de premières nécessités (sucre, riz). Elle désire voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions. Ce premier prêt l’aidera à acheter afin de répondre à la demande de ses nombreux clients. Elle s'approvisionne au marché de Lomé. Elle fait du jus de citron et du bissap.
texts.en: Married to an accountant and the mother of three children, Hézouwè is 28 and she lives in Agoé with her spouse. In  2010, she opened a shop in her home where she sells staple goods (sugar, rice, etc.). She would like to see her children grow up in good conditions. This first loan will help her to buy foodstuffs to respond to the demand of her numerous customers. She buys her goods at the market in Lomé. She makes lemon juice with hibiscus (flavoring).

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 51 years old and is married with two children aged 8 and 24. She sells milk and cakes in her shop. Her business is well-organized. She has three years' experience in her business and she works from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day. She currently employs one person to help her.

Beatrice has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a larger quantity of milk and cakes to sell. With any profit, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of milk and cakes to sell

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Harriet has operated a tailoring business for over 10 years, and she works 1 day every week. Harriet sells her products wholesale, in a shop. She has requested a loan of 1,300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of material for uniforms. Harriet generates additional income through farming. Harriet's main business challenges include defaulters and seasonality. Her business goal is to own at least 4 electric sewing machines. Harriet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of material for uniforms

loans.name: Afissetou

texts.fr: Mariée à un tailleur,  Afissetou a 41ans. Elle vend de l’huile végétale de façon ambulante. Vu son âge, elle veut avoir un prêt pour mieux vendre afin d’avoir une boutique. Elle a 02 enfants et est dans son 6eme année d’ancienneté dans cette activité.
texts.en: Married to a tailor, Afissetou is 41. She sells vegetable oil as an itinerant salesperson. In view of her age, she would like a loan so that she can make more sales so as to have a store. She has two children and is in her sixth year in this business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable oil.

loans.name: Bibetou

texts.fr: Dame de 53ans, Bibetou vend des objets en plastique et du mais. Pour aider son mari retraité, elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’approvisionner en bassines, sceaux, plats à Lomé. Elle a 10ans d’ancienneté dans cette activité et revend à domicile. Il vend aussi du mais.
texts.en: A lady of 53, Bibetou sells plastic-ware and maize. To help her husband who is retired, she is requesting this loan to stock up on basins, buckets, and platters in Lomé. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells out of her home. She also sells maize.

loans.use: to buy plastic-ware.

loans.name: Oltetia

texts.en:
Oltetia is 33 years old. He is married and has two children. Oltetia has been farming for the last seven years. His farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for mixed farming. Oltetia learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his third loan, which he is planning to use to buy farm produce, seeds and fertilizer. 

Oltetia hopes to use the profit from this loan to build a new house and educate his children. His hope and dream is to buy and build a rental premises. He is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm produce, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Poyodi

texts.fr: Jeune papa de 34ans, Poyodi  est comptable de profession. Sa femme est entrepreneur et ils ont 02 enfants en charge. Pour  mieux joindre les deux bouts et afin d’assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants, Il a décidé de créer un bar pour vendre de la boisson. Il s’approvisionne à la brasserie de Lomé et revend à  ses  nombreux clients qui viennent boire. Il est dans l’activité il ya 1an.
texts.en: A young father, 34 years old, Poyodi is an accountant by profession. His wife is a businesswoman and they have two children in their care. In order to better make ends meet and so as to assure a brilliant future for his children, Poyodi decided to establish a bar in order to sell drinks. He gets his supplies at the pub in Lomé and resells to his numerous clients who come to drink. He has been in business for one year.

loans.use: to purchase drinks

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 42 years old and single, with 7 children whose ages range from 4 to 18 years old. Monica has no other dependents and lives in her own house in Hoima District, Uganda.

Monica has been dealing in the textile business for 9 years. She started as a tailor and saved money to start her current business, through which she has been able to improve her finances and educate her children. So far, Monica doesn’t have any serious hardships. Her wish is to see her shop grow into a bigger wholesale business. Monica wants a loan to buy cloth to sell.

loans.use: to buy textiles for resale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Rehema has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Rehema sells her products at the market —  wholesale and retail. She has requested a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Rehema are defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start buying bananas direct from farmers and also to sell only wholesale. Rehema lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas to sell

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en: Meshack is 26 years old and supports his parents in meeting some of their financial needs. Meshack has a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. He started this business a year ago. From it he gets a profit of KES. 4000 a month. Meshack has borrowed a loan of KES. 5000 from KADET Ltd with which he intends to buy sheep to raise, as he wants to diversify. He anticipates using the profits to expand his business. Meshack hopes to get married, build rental houses, and purchase a car for his transport business.

loans.use: To Purchase Sheep

loans.name: Abuslom

texts.en: Abuslom is a 29-year-old married man with one child and he rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in second-hand clothes for four years. He started with 500,000 shillings and now has 3,000,000 shillings as working capital. His hardship is lack of enough capital to meet the increasing demands of his customers. His vision is opening another outlet, buying land, and building a house. Abuslom needs the money to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy  clothes to sell.

loans.name: Altanhuyag

texts.en: Altanhuyag is 31 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a rented house in Uvs province, Mongolia. His older daughter, age 8, attends a local secondary school while his second daughter, age 6, is in kindergarten. His wife is a chef. Altanhuyg is a guard and works at a private company with monthly salary of 400,000 MNT. He has been able to save some money for a car in order to start a taxi service business. Also he is planning to buy a plot of land where he can have a house for his family. He is a polite and kind man who says, "I dream to have a house some day." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT to have enough to buy a car that will be used in his taxi service business.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 31 years old and is married with two children aged 6 and 10. He owns a shop which sells local drinks. He has four years' experience in this business which is well known and well organized. The hours of his business are from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except on Saturday.

Theoneste has requested his first loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more sorghum to make local drinks to sell. With these profits, he will reinvest in his business and save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of sorghum to make soft drinks.

loans.name: Rabson

texts.en: Rabson is a twenty six year-old married man with three children. He owns a house in Kasese Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family solely rests on him and his desire is to educate his children up to university. He has been selling cassava flour for four years. His hardship is the rising price of agricultural products. His vision is to own a food store. Rabson needs the loan to buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: To buy cassava flour and beans  to sell sell.

loans.name: Arzigul

texts.ru: Арзигул проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. Ее сын находится в России. Сама Арзигул занимается растениеводством. Она в основном выращивает овощи и сеет рис для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 25 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений, чтобы посеять и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Arzigul lives in Jilikul. She is 43 years old, married, and has eight children. Her son is in Russia. Arzigul farms.  She basically grows vegetables and rice for sale. She has been doing this for 25 years. SHe is taking out a loan to buy seed and mineral fertilizer to plant and receive a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Altanzul

texts.en:
Altanzul, 35 years old, lives with her husband and five children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her older daughter, 19, attends college and her three younger children attend a local secondary school.

Altanzul manages a felt craft making business with the help of her husband. They started their business in 2002 and gained much experience. In 2008, they decided to start an agriculture business with their savings. They plant buckthorn and trees inside the greenhouse located on their land and sell their planted trees when they reach 2 years old. They earn 5 million MNT yearly from tree sales. They currently have 5 million MNT of inventory that will be sold this summer. They are hardworking people who contribute their earnings for their family's use. They say, "One must be healthy to lead a happy life." Altanzul is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase felt and seeds for her two businesses.

loans.use: To purchase felt and seeds

loans.name: Kengele

texts.en: Kengele is a 43-year-old married man with  six children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Kengele has been in the butchery business for twelve years. His hardships are debtors and competition from fish sellers. His goals are to open up other butcher shops  in the nearby trading centre and to have a well-educated family. Kengele needs this loan to buy goats to sell.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 44 years old, is a widow and a mother of six children aged between 16 and 25 years old. She has been supplying rice wholesale for three years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 50,000.

This is Grace's third loan term with KADET LTD and she has successfully managed to repay her previous loans. She will use the loan funds to buy ten bags of rice for resale. Grace hopes to educate her children and have a truck for supplying rice in the future.

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of rice

loans.name: Allégresse Plus Group

texts.en:
Léontine is the chairwoman of the community bank named “Allégresse Plus”. It is composed of 24 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Léontine is 57 years old, married and the mother of five children whose ages range from 19 to 41 years old. Only one of her children goes to school. Léontine's main activity is selling secondhand clothing and she has been active in her business for years. She began her business by operating a general store. Léontine also sells drinks. Her business is prospering and it generates a profit of $300 per month. Léontine intends to use this loan to increase her stock of goods by buying a bundle of secondhand clothing to resell at a profit in order to increase her capital. Her ambition is to become a secondhand clothing provider in her area. Léontine works hard in order to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to increase her stock of goods by buying a bundle of secondhand clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anhbayar

texts.en: Anhbayar is 31 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son, who is 5 years old, attends kindergarten. With the help of her husband she manages a clothing trading business at Narantuul, one of the busiest markets in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business 6 years ago and is planning to expand it in the future. She is diligent woman who says, "I want to continue my business." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase summer clothes to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase summer clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy suit materials for sewing.

loans.name: Roselidah

texts.en:
Roselidah, age 55, is married to John, and they are blessed with six children. She owns a mobile accessories shop that has been in operation for twelve years. The business earns her a monthly income of about 25,000 KES (~$292).

This is her fourth loan term with KADET LTD and she has successfully managed to repay her previous loans. She will use the funds to buy mobile phone credit cards and other phone accessories for resale.

Roselidah hopes to own a big phone accessories shop.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone credit cards and phone accessories.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine is a thirty-five-year-old married man with five children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been into bananas and vegetable growing for eighteen years and this has aided him in providing for the family. His hardships are pests, price fluctuation, thieves and high transport costs. His vision is having a well-maintained and model banana farm plus a well-educated family. Augustine needs the loan facility to buy manure.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  Harriet has a business of selling bananas.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. She sells her products from home by means of retail. 

Harriet has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Harriet include defaulters and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to farmers for bananas, and also to sell on a wholesale basis only. 

She lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the ingredients for making the detergent that she sells.

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan is 25 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia. They are a young couple who married recently. He manages a grocery store in his town. His wife used to operate the business; however, she is going to give birth soon.

Now Batsaihan’s mother works as a salesperson at his store and sends the earnings to his bank account. He himself is working at a bakery factory in order to supplement his earnings.

Batsaihan is a polite man who says, "One must work hard." He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for his store.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for his store.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is 31 years old and is married with two children aged 9 and 12 years of age. She also takes care of one relative who is 18 years old. She earns a living by selling cosmetics, breads, milk, juice, etc. This is her fourth successful year in business. She operates her business, which is well organized, from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day except on Saturday. She employs one person to help her.

Zawadi has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more breads, milk, juice, etc. to sell. By adding more products and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With this profit, she will save for her family and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock by buying more breads, milk, juice, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 28-year-old hardworking man renting a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has had a shop for two years which he started with 1,000,000 KES; he now has 4,000,000 KES. His challenge is the fluctuation in prices.

Julius needs a loan of 1,500,000 to buy maize flour, cassava flour and groundnuts to sell. His vision is to have a wholesale business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, cassava flour and groundnuts.

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Kasifa lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and utility bills.

Kasifa sells bananas, which she has been doing for less than a year. She works seven days a week. Kasifa sells her bananas at retail from home. Her main challenges include defaulters and the seasonality of her produce.

Kasifa has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going directly to farmers for her bananas and to sell at wholesale prices only.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 43 years old and married to Joseph, a driver and small-scale farmer. They have been blessed with nine children aged between nineteen and seven years old.

Emily runs a secondhand clothing shop in Kiptuno trading center which she opened six years ago. From her business Emily earns a profit of 5,000 KES a month.

Emily has asked for a loan of 20,000 KES from KADET Ltd. She anticipates using the loan to purchase stock for her business and top dressing fertilizers for their family’s farm.

Emily will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and save for her children’s education. Her dream is to be a successful businesswoman, be able to give her children the best education possible and to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand clothing for her shop.

loans.name: Yao Eric

texts.fr: Yao a 33ans. Il est chauffeur de profession et répare des voitures. Il est à son premier prêt et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des outils de travail. Il s’approvisionne au port autonome de Lomé. Sa femme est revendeuse et ils ont trois enfants .Eric a pour objectif premier d’apporter une meilleure condition de vie sociale  à sa famille.
texts.en: Yao Eric is 33 years old. He is a driver by profession and repairs cars. This is his first loan and he is seeking this sum in order to buy tools for his work. He gets his supplies at the independent port in Lomé. His wife is a retailer and they have three children. Yao Eric's primary objective is to improve the social circumstances of his family.

loans.use: to buy tools for vehicle repair

loans.name: Buyanjargal

texts.en:
Buyanjargal lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province in Mongolia. His older two children attend the local secondary school.

With the help of his wife, Buyanjargal runs a cobbler's shop in his town. They started their business in 2007 and gained much experience. In addition, they began working at a private company in order to supplement their earnings. Buyanjargal earns 350,000 MNT a month while his wife earns 400,000 MNT.

Now Buyanjargal and his wife have many regular customers who purchase many shoes at a time. With their earnings they bought a plot of land on which they can build a house in the future. Buyanjargal is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment for his business. He is a kind man who says, "I want to buy new equipment in order to increase my sales."

loans.use: To purchase new cobbler's equipment.

loans.name: Safouratou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits génériques (vitamines, nifluril, antibiotique) et des sacs scolaires depuis 1990. Elle est célibataire et maman d’01 enfant. Elle achète au grand Marché de Lomé et revend à domicile. Elle a 40ans
texts.en: Safouratou has been a retailer of generic goods (vitamins, nifluril [niflumic acid - an analgesic, anti-inflammatory product], antibiotics) and school bags since 1990. She is single and the mother of one child. She buys at the Grand Market in Lomé and resells at home. She is 40 years old.

loans.use: to buy generic goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy auto parts for his transportation business.

loans.name: Arinzechukwu E.

texts.fr: Revendeur de pièces frigorifiques et climatiseur auto, Arinzechukwu a 47ans et papa de 04 enfants. Sa femme est revendeuse.  Il s’approvisionne au NIGERIA et revend dans sa boutique. Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter des gaz et des ventilateurs.
texts.en:
A retailer of refrigeration parts and car air conditioners, Arinzechukun is 47 years old and a father of four. His wife is a reseller.
He gets his supplies from Nigeria and resales in his shop. This loan will allow him to buy gasses and fans.

loans.use: to purchase refrigeration gasses and fans.

loans.name: Handmaa

texts.en:
Handmaa is 49 years old and lives with her son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Songinohairhan district in Mongolia. Her son is a student who manages a taxi service in his spare time.

Handmaa runs a grocery store in a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2008 and is planning to expand her business. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

She is an honest woman who says, "I want to receive a loan to expand and continue my business."

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 31 years old and is married with four children. She earns a living by selling charcoal. This is her second successful year in business. She operates her business, which is well-organized, from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day. She employs five people to help her.

Alice has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more charcoal to sell. By adding more sacks of charcoal and more workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With the profit, she will save for her family in order to pay school fees for her children and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the restaurant’s stock by buying a box of eggs, meat, and some crates of soft drinks.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 35 years old and is married with two children aged 7 and 11 years of age. She has a store selling foodstuffs and items such as body lotion, cooking oil, rice, beans and cassava flour. Her business is well organized and she employs two people to help her. She has three years of experience and her business is open from 6 a.m. until 11 p.m. every day.

Jeannette has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more foodstuffs and items such as body lotion, cooking oil, rice, beans, cassava flour, etc. for sale.  With any profits, she will reinvest in her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase body lotion, cooking oil, rice, beans, cassava flour, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and utility bills.

Aisha sells charcoal. She has done so for ten years, and she works seven days a week. Aisha sells her charcoal at retail prices from her home. She also sells tomatoes. The main business challenges for Aisha include thieves and tomato seasonality.

Aisha has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going directly to villages for her charcoal and to sell at wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more  bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 40 years old and married with six children between 7 and 23 years old. She owns a small business selling various styles of clothing for weddings and other clothing for sale. She employs one person from her community as a helper and her hours of business are from 8am until 7pm every day except on Saturday. This is her fourth successful year of business.

Clementine has requested her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more clothes for weddings and other clothes to sell. This loan will allow her to attract more customers, which will help her to earn more profit. With this profit, Clementine will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy secondhand shoes for sale.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 58-year-old married man with six children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in poultry farming and rearing goats for 10 years in which he started with local chicken and now has layers. His is challenged by thieves who target his farm for chicken. He dreams of having two big poultry farms plus educating his children. Edward needs the loan to buy chicks for his poultry farm and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy chicks for his poultry farm and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Mudzimai Manhasi Group

texts.en:
Joyce (holding the sweater) is 43 years of age. She is from the city of Mutare, the capital of Manicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is married with five children aged 4, 13, 19, 23 and 26. Four of her children attend school. Her husband is in the army.

Joyce runs a business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges faced are market problems. Joyce has requested a loan of $400 to boost her business stock by buying more clothes such as blouses and sweaters for the winter. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to have an improved lifestyle. In the future, Joyce plans to take her business to the next level.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 25-year-old married man with one child, living in a rented house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the tailoring business for eight years. Before that he previously dealt in the transport business with a bicycle, then later with a motorcycle. He then shifted to cattle selling, after which he switched to tailoring. His hardship is bad debtors and his vision is buying more tailoring machines. Emmanuel needs the loan to buy clothing to make clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy clothing for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 29-year-old married man with three children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

His family goal is to develop a bigger tea plantation estate so as to be able to have sustainable income, as well as to educate his children to tertiary levels. He started his tea business 10 years ago on family land and later bought his own. The major challenge he faces is inadequate funds to clear more land and scarce tea plantation laborers. He has hope that if he gets enough funds, he will have a bigger tea estate.

Robert needs this loan for clearing land to enable him to plant more tea for selling.

loans.use: to pay for labor that will clear more farm land for tea planting.

loans.name: Noumonvi

texts.fr: Propriétaire d’un dépôt de boisson à AGOé Assiyéyé Noumonvi est agé de 26 ans et marié à une revendeuse mais ne sont pas encore  parents.il a commencé son activité en 2010 et ne lésine pas sur les moyens pour assurer un bon avenir à se enfants qui naîtront. Ce crédit va lui permettre de s’approvisionner plus dans les débits de boissons de la brasserie du bénin(BB) pour fidéliser sa clientèle .
texts.en: Noumonvi is owner of a beverage warehouse in Agoe Assiyeye. He is 26 years old and married to a retailer, but they are not yet parents.  He started his business in 2010 and is doing whatever he can to guarantee a good future for his children who will be born. This loan will allow him to stock up on more beverages from the Benin Brasserie (BB) to increase customer loyalty.

loans.use: to buy pub beverages for resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 36 years old, married, with five children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He dreams of having a permanent house and educating his children up to the university level. He has been in the goat-rearing business for 10 years in addition to being a tea trader and farmer. His major challenge now is shortage of labor as he tries to expand on his tea plantation.

He needs the loan to buy tea seedlings and also to pay labor for clearing more land for planting.

loans.use: to buy tea seedlings and also to pay labor for clearing more land for planting.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, tiene 21 años y  está cursando el 1° año de la carrera de Enfermería  en la UTIC, esta carrera tiene una duración de 4 años.
Su padre trabaja en la agricultura, se dedica a la ventas de productos agrícolas como mandioca, maíz, y también comercializa postes. Ella le ayuda a sus padres en los que haceres diaR. y también quiere dedicarse a la venta de ropas en forma ambulante y así tener un ingreso que le permita costear su estudio.
Ella tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera, lo cual implica mucho esfuerzo, ella está consciente y convencida a enfrentar dicho desafío.
Ella solicita el credito para el pago de las mensualidades de la carrera ya que la misma implica muchos gastos.
texts.en:
Silvia is from the city of Caaguazú.  She is 21 years old, and is in her first year of nursing studies at UTIC (Universidad Tecnológica Intercontinental).  This course of study takes 4 years.

Her father works in agriculture focusing on the sale of agricultural products like cassava and maize, and he also sells posts. She helps her parents in their daily activities and also wants to work selling clothing as a street vendor, so she can have an income that allows her to afford to study.

She is eager to complete her course of study, which will involve much effort.  She is conscientious and confident in facing this challenge.

She is seeking the loan for the payment of the monthly fees for her studies since it involves much expense.

loans.use: to pay the fee for her nursing studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 55 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Carmen de 56 años de edad. Ellos tienen  2 Hijos, todos mayores de edad que trabajan de forma independiente.
El junto a su señora tienen una modesta despensa, con lo cual pueden mantenerse de forma decorosa. Ellos ya tienen una clientela bien formada, ya que desde hace ya varios años se dedican a este trabajo. Por medio de su despensa ellos pudieron ofrecer una vida digna y decorosa a sus hijos.
Ya que sus hijos ya no dependen de ellos, el trabajo que realizan es para el sustento de ellos, para poder así asegurarse una subsistencia sin privaciones ni necesidades futuras. El solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderías con lo que podrá abastecerse y así ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes. Las mercaderías consistirían en carnes, bebidas, hortalizas, es decir artículos en general para la venta.
texts.en:
Señor Mario is from the city of Santaní.  He is 55 years old, and is married to Señora Carmen who is 56. They have 2 grown children who work independently from them.  He runs a modest store together with his wife, which they are able to maintain decently.  They already have a well-established clientele since they have been doing this work for several years. Through their store they were able to provide a decent and dignified life for their children.

Because their children no longer depend on them, their work now is to support themselves, so as to be able to secure a livelihood free from want and future needs.  He is requesting the loan for the purchase of goods so he can stock up to offer more variety to its customers.  The goods consist of meat, drinks, vegetables, i.e. general items for sale.

loans.use: to buy meat, drinks, vegetable and other items to stock up his store.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 24 years old and married. He is blessed with a three year-old daughter. For the past two years, he has run a kiosk (retail shop) in the Kibotany trading center. He earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES. 

Ronald is requesting a loan of 5,000 KES from KADET LTD to purchase more stock for his business which includes tea leaves, detergents, rice, flour and many more. He anticipates that his monthly income will increase after receiving his loan as he will have more products to sell.

Ronald plans to save his profits for the future education of his children. He dreams of being a successful businessman and giving his children the best possible education.

loans.use: To purchase more stock (like tea leaves, detergents, rice, and flour) for his retail shop

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 33 years old and married with two children, ages six and five years old.  Moses runs a boutique in the Kibotany trading centre.  He earns a monthly income of about KES. 10,000 which he uses to take care of his family.

He has been loaned KES.5,000 from KADET Ltd.  This is his first loan from KADET.  He intends to use the entire loan to purchase more stock for his shop

He plans to use the anticipated profit to establish wholesale boutique shop.  In the future, he hopes to establish a supermarket in his home town.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and medicines to minimize plant pest damage

loans.name: Kuntura

texts.en:
Kuntura is 27 years old . He is married and is the father of three children.  He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last ten years.  His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for mixed farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence.  This will be his third loan which he is planning to use to buy farm supplies.  He hopes to use the profit from this loan to build a new house and to educate his children.

His hope and dream is to buy and build a rental property.  He is an energetic man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 27 years old, married with one child who is  3 years old.  He is living in his own house in Hioma Uganda.

For 3 years Godfrey has been running a transport business and from it he has been able to provide for his family. He has been laying bricks where he saved and bought a plot of land, which is expensive and hard to acquire.  He has hopes of buying a taxi for transport in the future. Godfrey wants a loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a 31-year-old single lady who started  a clothes retail business at her home six years ago.

Over these six years, Taghreed was able to open her own boutique in a busy area that customers can easily get to. Even her prices are very convenient, according to what her customers say.

Now Taghreed has applied for a loan to add new clothing models that go with the fashion these days and of course that suit most people's tastes, so she can raise her income and open another branch in the future.

loans.use: To add new models/styles of clothes to her boutique inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy local gin.

loans.name: Feza

texts.en:
A 33-year-old married mother of two children aged three and six years, Feza has been operating a well-organized business selling a variety of clothes for five years. Open from 7:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. every weekday, she employs one person to help her.

Feza has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more child and adult clothing to sell. With the profits arising from the loan, she plans to save for her family's future, pay school fees for her children and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase child and adult clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, a 24-year-old married woman with two children, lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For the past 11 years she has been operating a business selling fresh foods, the profits from which have enabled her to start up a clothing business. Because she operates in the open, weather is the major challenge she faces. Her dream is to open a boutique.

Sarah is requesting this loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell. Her goals are to build her own house and develop rental units in order to diversify her family income.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, a 46-year-old Ugandan male who hails from Kyenjojo District, is married and has six children ranging in age from 16 to 7 years. He lives in a semi-permanent house with an iron roof, and one of his chief family goals is to educate his children up to university level.

Wilson obtained the start-up capital for his retail business by burning and selling charcoal. He is requesting this loan to purchase sugar, cooking oil and cassava flour to resell, and wants his business to grow to include trade in wholesale items. The main problem Wilson faces are customers who buy on credit and take a long to pay.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil and cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Roben

texts.en:
Roben, a maize trader who hails from Kyenjojo District, is a Ugandan father of six children. Married to a farmer, he owns a four-bedroom temporary house and dreams of educating his children so that they can be self-sustaining. 

In his business for 15 years, Roben began as a farmer and later started purchasing maize from other farmers. He is requesting this loan to buy more maize to sell. Roben's main business hardship are fluctuating prices, and his dream is to own a food store.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more water fitting equipment

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 44 years old.  She is married with six children who are between 6 and 17 years old.  She sells items such as: cooking oil, juice, rice, bananas and so on. Her business is well-organized. She has been in this business for one year and she works from 6 am until 9 pm everyday except on Saturday. She currently employs one person to help her.

To improve her business, Francoise has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more goods like: rice, bananas, books, water, cooking oil and juice to sell.  With the extra profits, Francoise will reinvest in her business and save for her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like: rice, bananas, books, water and so on to sell.

loans.name: Sana’A

texts.en:
Sana'a is a 28 year old single woman from Nao'or, Jordan.
Sana'a was raised in Nao'or with one brother with whom she still lives. Sana'a 's aunt taught her how to make baskets and home décor (like dried flower bouquets) from straw and organic materials. 

One day, Sana'a heard a radio advertisement for Tamweelcom and started to imagine the possibility of developing her own project. She persuaded her aunt to take a small group loan just for purchasing the raw materials to make her artistic decorations. Their project progressed well in the past year; now, Sana'a is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to enlarge her business. Although Sana'a still works from home, she would like to offer her customers more variety and a larger selection of home decorations to include wall hangings made of tapestry and dried flowers; three-tier baskets that hang from the ceiling, graduating in size, to hold fruits and vegetables in the kitchen, table centerpieces made of organic materials, etc.

Sana'a dreams of a better life for herself and her brother. Sana'a would like to expand her product-line, her clientele, her marketing capacity by eventually establishing a brand name and possibly a shop of her own.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and make a larger and more varied product-line

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.ru: Рухшона проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Рухшона имеет среднее образование. Она более 6 лет занимается животноводством. В основном она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Rukhshona lives in J.Rumy. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children. Rukhshona has a secondary education. She has been working in animal husbandry for more than six years.  Basically she breeds cattle for sale. She is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a hardworking 33 year-old man with three children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has dreams of constructing rental houses on the plot of land he acquired two years ago and buying more land. Innocent rides a motorcycle for a living and has been in service for eight years now despite challenges of the increasing price of fuel and mechanical breakdowns. His desire is to own at least three motorcycles and buy land in the outskirts of town for farming.
Innocent intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: To purchase land for farming.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy, a 38-year-old married man with five children, lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda and operates a retail shop that he started with 250,000 Ugx, an amount which has since grown to about five million. His main challenges include bad customer debts and ever-increasing rental costs.

Jimmy is requesting a loan to buy foodstuffs for sale, and his business goal is to own a food store. His family goals are to pay school fees for his children and to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 35-year-old married man with two children who lives in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For the past four years, he has been in the motorcycle transport business. John bought his first motorcycle with money he earned from farming. His greatest business challenge is the mechanical breakdown of his motorcycles. John plans to own at least five motorcycles and to buy land for farming.

John is requesting a loan to buy farmland. He is the sole income earner in his family and his dream is to have enough income sources to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy land for farming

loans.name: Omayma

texts.en:
Omayma is a 35-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is from Bani Kenanah, an impoverished community in Irbid, Jordan, and comes from a comparatively small family of four girls. Omayma and her sisters were raised by her mother and grandmother. Omayma and her mother and sisters were abandoned by their father when they were all young so they moved into their mother’s family home where they were raised by “a village” of extended family.  Even so, they could not escape the poverty that would not allow them to get an education. Realizing that not being educated would handicap her daughters, Omayma’s mother stepped in and taught her girls how to sew and embroider women’s clothing. Omayma found her passion – she loves to sew.

After her first year of marriage, Omayma gave birth to a beautiful baby girl. Sine then, her family has grown to include two more daughters – all loved and cherished by their doting mother. Omayma has never lost her love for creating women’s fashion and has established a small business from her home to enable her to work and raise her daughters at the same time.  

Omayma envisions her creations long before each item takes its finA. form. She starts creating a new piece of clothing by first imagining how it will look, then drawing a picture of the dress and asking one of her friends to model while she drapes and pins the materiA. to bring her design to life. From there, Omayma sews the pieces together and finishes it with ornate embroidery. Omayma has gradually built a clientele from the members of her immediate community and she is developing a reputation for her beautiful designs that extends beyond Irbid. 

Omayma is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase a modern sewing machine, storage boxes to organize her supplies, and hanging display racks to best display her creations.

As Omayma can imagine a new design, she can also dream big – she dreams of expanding her project throughout the Kingdom and making a name for herself. She hopes to increase her clientele and her income. Someday, Omayma would like to be able to give her daughters an opportunity to carry on the family business or feel the freedom to pursue their own dreams.

loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing machine, storage boxes, and hanging display racks

loans.name: Edreda

texts.en:
Edreda is 45 years old and a single mother with eight children. She lives with her family in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been selling clothes for twenty years. Edreda’s business has been profitable despite the challenge of limited finances to meet the demands of her customers. 

Edreda is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell. Her dream is to own a wholesale clothing shop. She also would like to buy a plot in town and build rental houses to help support her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Basbi

texts.ru: Басби проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 51 год. Вдова, имеет 6 детей. Дети работаю заграницей. Сама Басби занимается растениеводством и одновременно животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Кроме того она при доме имеет небольшой участок земли, где сеет рис. Этим видом деятельности она занимается два года. Кредит берет для посева риса и закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Basbi lives in Jilikul. She is 51 years old, a widow, and has six children. Her children work abroad. Basbi works in farming and in animal husbandry.  She raises cattle at home. Additionally, at home she has a small plot of land where she grows rice.  She has been doing this for two years. She is taking out a loan to sow a rice crop and to buy cattle.

loans.use: to sow a rice crop and to buy cattle.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.en:
Lazaro is a 49-year-old married man with six children who lives with his family in a two-room rented house in Kasese, Uganda. For the past eight years, he has been a coffee farmer and his work has enabled him to pay school fees for his children. Lazaro’s business hardships are coffee price fluctuations and his limited capital. Nevertheless, he longs to be the leading coffee farmer in his region. 

Lazaro is requesting a loan to buy coffee to plant.

loans.use: to buy coffee to plant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 54-year-old married man with fourteen children and  he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in produce, specifically beans, for four years and he got his initial capital from poultry farming. His hardship is price fluctuations and  his vision is a stock of 100 bags plus improving his family's living conditions. Samuel needs the loan to buy beans for sale.

loans.use: To buy beans.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррина проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 33 года. Разведена, имеет одного ребенка. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Она арендует торговую точку на рынке "Саховат" города, где продает женское нижнее белье. Кредит берет для приобретения новых видов нижнего белья.
texts.en: Zarrina lives in Kulob. She is 33 years old, divorced, and has one child. She has been working in trade for more than five years. She rents a shop in the Sakhovat city market where she sells women's underwear. She is taking out a loan to buy new kinds of underwear.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of underwear.

loans.name: Kihara Road Group

texts.en:
Yoweri is a 62-year-old married man with four children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in farming and retail business for twenty years and this has facilitated him in providing for his family. 

His hardship is lack of enough capital to meet the increasing customer demand and his vision is a wholesale shop plus educating his children. Yoweri needs the loan  to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Zabibu

texts.en:
Zabibu is 30 years old and is married with three children aged between 5 and 9 years old. She owns a small business selling various styles of clothes for women such as: African clothes and so on. She employs one person from her community as a helper and her hours of business are from 7am until 6pm every day. This is her first successful year of business.

Zabibu has requested a first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more women's clothes such as: African clothes and so on, for sale. This loan will allow her to attract more customers, which will help her to earn more profit. Zabibu plans to use the profit for reinvesting in her business and to save money for her future.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more African women's clothes for sale.

loans.name: Zaro

texts.ru: Заро проживает в городе Куляб. Ей 34 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии проработала 4 года. На сегодняшний день она занимается изготовлением и торговлей. Она печет торты и пирожное для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения сухофруктов и сахара.
texts.en: Zaro lives in Kulob. She is 34 years old, married, and has two children. She has a higher education in pedagogy. She worked in her profession for four years.  Now she works in manufacturing and trade. She bakes pies and cakes for sale. She has been doing this for six years. She is taking out a loan to buy dried fruit and sugar.

loans.use: to buy dried fruit and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his stock of goods and generate additional profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla decided to start her multiservice company, Precise Multiservices, three months ago. After working in the multiservice industry (which offers clients access to legal, notary, and tax services) for 10 years, Perla realized that she could offer these services to a community that she felt needed them most.

Originally from Monterrey, Mexico, Perla began working in the multiservices industry in the U.S. when she was 16, gaining experience as a notary with a local multiservice company in Houston, Texas. The work was immediately gratifying to Perla because, as she says, she was “doing something for somebody that they wouldn’t be able to take care of on their own.” From her first job, Perla worked constantly to better herself and the community around her. Growing up with a strong sense of family values, she balanced work, school, and family responsibilities as she grew her experience in the business. 

While Perla valued all of the clients she served in the early years of her career, she found working with clients in the Hispanic communities in Houston particularly fulfilling. Many of these clients were members of low-income families with little or no education on how to complete the complex legal forms necessary to live in the United States. Because she was helping people with such unique needs, these clients quickly found a place in Perla’s heart. As a result, she slowly began to work independently with non-English speakers and their families to manage and file complicated immigration materials alongside her full-time work with larger multiservice companies.

Now, at 26, Perla is ready to take her business expertise to the next level. She says that she has been ready to start her own business for a few years but has been unable to do so for financial reasons. With this loan, she will make her dream come true. She will use the money to purchase office equipment and supplies for her at-home office space, professional business software to design a website and print business cards, and a color laser printer to offer her clients more prompt and reliable printing and copying services. 

When asked what she hopes for her business in the coming years, Perla remains faithful to her family-oriented upbringing: “I hope to turn this into a family business….to move our business into a location where our services are most needed.”

Without her loan, Perla says she wouldn’t have been able to turn her dream into a reality. With this in mind, her advice to aspiring entrepreneurs is to “never give up on your dreams. It might take a while, but, if you stay with it, something good is bound to happen.”

loans.use: to pay for office equipment and supplies, business software, and a color laser printer.

loans.name: Mahtumbi

texts.ru: Махтумби проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 57 лет. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Она занимается торговлей на рынке. Арендует торговую точку, где продает детскую одежду. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Mahtumbi lives in the town of Kulob. 57 years of age. Married, with two children. She works as a vendor at the local market. She rents out  a stand, where she sells children’s clothing. She has been in this business for 10 years. She is taking out a loan in order to buy goods for the new season.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing for the new season

loans.name: Aliceson

texts.en:
Aliceson’s motivation for starting her daycare center, Kingdom Kidz Academy, was that, as she says, “providing young parents with affordable and reliable daycare services is the only way to put Texas back to work.” She started Kingdom Kidz because she saw a need in her Katy, Texas community for young, working parents to have access to reasonably priced daycare services. Without this access, she says these parents could not afford to go to work each day.

What makes Kingdom Kidz special doesn’t end there, however, because walking into the Kingdom Kidz is less like walking into a playpen and more like walking into a school. Aliceson splits the children’s time into activity time, during which students are able to play and interact freely with each other, and what she calls curriculum time. During curriculum time, the young students work with math, reading and computer literacy tasks. “I have a big, loving heart, but I also have very high expectations for education,” she says.

Aliceson feels that her biggest business success to date has been seeing children as young as one beginning to read. Though Aliceson has seen impressive success with her current location, she hopes to extend her reach by opening multiple locations that provide the same excellent service as her current center. “My goal is to see an excellent academic rate, with the children under my care more than ready for elementary school when they leave my center.”

Along the impressive results her program produces, Aliceson attributes her business success to the joy she brings to her children. She says that one of the biggest challenges in her business is becoming a household name that parents can trust. She built this trust by creating a comfortable and stimulating environment for her children – one which they are sometimes reluctant to leave. “By the end of the day, the children don’t want to go home, and they are excited to come back the next morning.”

With this loan, Aliceson will build an even stronger learning environment for her young students. She will purchase arts and crafts supplies, a laminator, a computer (with which children can learn basic computer skills), and blocks. With the remainder of the loan, she says she will buy things she can utilize to make her curriculum better, such as printers and planning documents.

Without this loan, Aliceson would not be able to obtain the resources necessary to reach the high expectations she holds for her children’s education. She reached out to the Kiva partner Accion Texas-Louisiana after being denied a loan at a commercial bank. Not only will this loan allow Aliceson to continue her mission of putting Texas back to work, it will help her to continue building a bright future for the children under her care and for her community.

loans.use: to pay for arts and crafts supplies, a laminator, a computer, and curriculum materials.

loans.name: Arbejitas Group

texts.es:
'Arbejitas' es un grupo solidario de Credituyo que se encuentra en su primer ciclo, está formado por 6 integrantes con pequeños negocios al norte de la ciudad de Monterrey. Ellas escogieron ese nombre para el grupo porque así se llama la calle en donde realizan sus reuniones semanales. La mayoría de sus integrantes se dedican al comercio de ropa nueva y usada en el mercado.

Cinthia Elizabeth es una de las integrantes del grupo, tiene 3 hijas, está embarazada y vive en unión libre. Cinthia se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva en un mercado cerca de su casa y además tiene un snack en su casa en donde vende refrescos, golosinas y botanas. Ella apoya a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que éste es albañil y en ocasiones no tiene trabajo. Con su crédito, Cinthia espera comprar varias pacas de ropa para venderla y aumentar sus utilidades.Una de las metas a largo plazo de Cinthia es poner un CyberCafé (Internet Cafe) en su casa ya que ella cree que es un buen negocio en su comunidad.
texts.en:
'Arbejitas' is a solidarity group with Credituyo that is in its first lending cycle.  It consists of 6 members with small businesses to the north of Monterrey city.  They chose that name for the group because it's the name of the street where they hold their weekly meetings.  Most of the group's members work selling new and used clothing at the market.

Cynthia Elizabeth is one of the group members; she has 3 daughters and is pregnant, and lives with her partner.  Cynthia sells new clothes at the market near her home, and also has a snack stand at home where she sells soft drinks, sweets and snacks.  She supports her husband with household expenses since he works in construction and sometimes does not have work.  

With this loan, Cynthia hopes to buy several bales of clothes to sell and increase her profits.  One of her long-term goals is to create a cybercafe (Internet Cafe) in her home, which she believes is a good business in her community.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell at the market.

loans.name: Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her early 50s is married with ten children; some of them are still going to school. She has had a business of stone quarrying since 1985.  She works from 6am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying more big stones for making gravel.  Her dream is to one day own a food shop.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Bega kwa Bega" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more big stones for quarrying.

loans.name: Msimamo Group

texts.en:
Kadala is in her early 50s and is married with one grown-up child. She has been running a food vendor business for 13 years now. She works from 6am to 3pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This is her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the items which were out of stock.  She has paid back her loan successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy 50 kilos of rice, a small bucket of cooking oil and 50 kilos of beans.  Her dream is to one day buy a plot of land.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Msimamo" which has a total of 16 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy 50 kilos of rice, a small bucket of cooking oil, and 50 kilos of beans.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: El Sr. Adolfo de 44 años de edad, vive en la zona Mutualista en  casa familiar, convive con la Sra. Olga que tienen un hijo de 3 añitos, el Sr. Adolfo se dedica al servicio de taxi, hace mas de 4 años el cual le esta yendo bien ya que con sus ganancias fueron juntando hasta llegar a abrir un "punto de llamas" en su mismo domicilio, el cual lo atiende su esposa la Sra. Olga que de esa manera le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. El crédito que se le otorgo fue para hacerle mantenimiento en general de uno de sus vehículos (compra de repuestos). El Sr. quedo muy agradecido por la confianza que le brinda Emprender al otorgarle  dicho crédito.
texts.en: Adolfo is 44 years old and lives in his family home in the Mutualista zone. He lives with Olga, and together they have a son who is just 3 years old. For more than 4 years, Adolfo has worked providing taxi services. The work has gone well for him; in fact, by saving up his earnings, he has even been able to open a "call point" [dispatch center] in his own home. The call point is operated by his wife Olga, who contributes in this way to the household expenses. The loan that has been granted to Adolfo will be used to perform general maintenance on one of his vehicles (buying replacement parts). Adolfo very much appreciates the confidence placed in him by Emprender in granting him this loan.

loans.use: to carry out general maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Canter Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her late 20s, is married with one pair of twins who go to school. She has had a business selling charcoal at a place called Mbezi for two years now. She works from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
This will be Fatuma's second loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loan to buy land, increase her charcoal stock and pay household expenses. She paid back that loan successfully.
Fatuma now hopes for a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. She will share this loan with her loan group "Canter", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. Fatuma's dream is to one day have an individual loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 33 years old, married and has one child who is one year old. Christine sells milk at the market. Her business is well-organized and she works from 6am until 10pm every day. She has one year's experience.
Christine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase a large quantity of milk. With her profits, Christine will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of milk.

loans.name: Esperanza En Cristo Group

texts.en: Oscar, Brenda and Martina, who all reside in San Lorenzo, Honduras, formed the “Esperanza En Cristo” solidarity group in June 2011. Oscar has worked for many years as a mason and is requesting a loan of Lps. 10,000 to install a floor in the house he is building for his family. Brenda earns a living by selling homemade baked goods and Martina runs a small business making and selling tortillas.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and rebar.

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en:
